Donald Trump, g\u00f6steri\u015fli dili: While Donald Trump has been widely criticized for his bombast and insults, 52 percent of leaned Republican voters nationwide think that the real estate mogul has the right temperament to be president, according to Monday's ABC News/Washington Post poll.

Birle\u015fik Krall\u0131k'taki \u00fccr: Pound rises as UK wage growth accelerates
The pound jumped following data showing a pick-up in UK wage growth, while the FTSE 100 was led higher by bid target SABMiller.
Birle\u015fik Krall\u0131k'taki prim har: Between May and July, UK earnings excluding bonuses grew 2.9% compared with the same period last year.
2009'dan bu yana en h\u0131zl\u0131 art\: The rate was the fastest since 2009, and was seen as bringing forward estimates of when rates might rise.
Sterlin ABD dolar\u0131na kar\u015f\u013: Sterling rose more than 1% against the dollar to $1.5505 and was up 0.84% against the euro at €1.3730.
FTSE 100 Endeksi ise %1,49'luk art\u0131: The FTSE 100 index closed up 1.49% to 6,229.21.
Bu y\u00fckseli\u015fte en \u00e7ok g\u0: SABMiller was the stand-out stock on the market, jumping 20% after it received a bid approach from rival AB InBev.
Bu teklif d\u00fcnyan\u0131n en b\u00fcy: A deal would combine the world's two largest brewers, bringing together brands such as Budweiser, Stella Artois, Peroni and Grolsch.
Burberry hisseleri rakip l\u00fcks perak: Burberry shares were 0.9% higher following encouraging news from rival luxury goods group Richemont.
Richemont'un g\u00fcncel sat\u0131\u015f: Richemont's latest sales figures beat expectations and also showed that sales in China - a key market for Burberry - had begun to grow again.
Madencilik devi Glencore'un hisseleri, \: Shares in Glencore rose 5% after the mining giant said it had raised $2.5bn through a share placement as part of its debt-cutting strategy.
Ambalaj ve ka\u011f\u0131t grubu Mondi'n: Shares in packaging and paper group Mondi were the biggest fallers on the index, down 4.3%, after Goldman Sachs cut its rating on the firm to "sell."
JD Sports'un hissesi \u015firketin alt\u: JD Sports rose 3.1% after the sportswear firm reported an 83% jump in half-year pre-tax profits to £46.6m.
JD Sports patronu daha y\u00fcksek maa\u: JD Sports boss says higher wages could hurt expansion
JD Sports Y\u00f6netim Kurulu Ba\u015fka: JD Sports Executive Chairman Peter Cowgill says a higher minimum wage for UK workers could mean "more spending power in the pockets of potential consumers."
Ancak bu harcama g\u00fcc\u00fcn\u00fcn: But that spending power is unlikely to outweigh the higher labour costs at his firm, he says.
Masraflar\u0131n JD Sports'un geni\u015f: The costs could hit JD Sports' expansion plans, he added, which could mean fewer extra jobs.
Metcash, Aldi istilas\u0131yla m\u00fcca: Metcash launches grassroots campaign to fight Aldi incursion
Metcash, G\u00fcney Avustralya ve Bat\u0: Metcash is trying to protect its IGA stores from an Aldi onslaught in South Australia and Western Australia.
Market toptanc\u0131s\u0131 Metcash, G\u: Grocery wholesaler Metcash has kicked off a grassroots campaign to defend the market share of IGA retailers in South Australia and Western Australia ahead of a $700 million Aldi invasion.
Aldi, \u00f6n\u00fcm\u00fczdeki y\u0131l: As Aldi prepares to open two distribution centres and the first of as many as 120 stores in South Australia and Western Australia early next year, Metcash and IGA supermarkets are strengthening relationships with local food suppliers and building the IGA brand through mainstream and social media marketing and events such as the Adelaide show.
IGA pekendecileri ve tedarik\u00e7ileri: IGA retailers and suppliers are jumping on board, with brands such as Dunsborough-based ice cream maker Simmo's offering taste testing at IGA stores and store owners selling discounted South Australian football league tickets to loyal customers.
G\u0131da, i\u00e7ki ve donan\u0131m top: Metcash is expected to reveal more details of its defence strategy on September 29, when the food, liquor and hardware wholesaler hosts its annual investor strategy day.
Risk b\u00fcy\u00fck, zira G\u00fcney Av: There is much at stake, as South Australia and Western Australia account for almost 30 per cent of Metcash's IGA store footprint and generate higher profit margins than Metcash's IGA network in the eastern states.
G\u00fcney Avustralya ve Bat\u0131 Avust: South Australian and Western Australian shoppers are notoriously parochial and IGA retailers enjoy a much stronger market share than they do in NSW, Victoria and Queensland - more than 30 per cent in SA and 24 per cent in WA compared with around 14 per cent in the Eastern states.
Ancak Morgan Stanley gibi analistler Ald: However, analysts such as Morgan Stanley believe Aldi will snare around 5 per cent of the grocery market in these two states within 12 months of opening its first stores, taking sales from all existing players but mainly from independent retailers.
Bu hafta yay\u0131nlanan bir raporda, Mo: In a report this week, Morgan Stanley analyst Tom Kierath estimated that IGA retailers could lose $360 million a year in sales and Metcash $250 million by the end of 2016.
Bu tahmin, Aldi'nin \u00f6n\u00fcm\u00fc: This forecast is based on the assumption that Aldi opens 25 stores in SA and 30 in WA next year, generating sales of $500 million and $600 million in each market.
Bay Kierath, g\u0131da ve market sat\u01: The loss of food and grocery sales and volumes on Metcash's high fixed-cost base could cost Metcash around $13 million in earnings before interest and tax, Mr Kierath said.
Ayn\u0131 zamanda Metcash, IGA m\u00fc\u: At the same time, Metcash is losing market share in the eastern states, mainly to Aldi and Coles, even though a recent Roy Morgan survey found IGA shoppers were most loyal.
Morgan Stanley'e g\u00f6re Metcash'in g\: Morgan Stanley believes Metcash's food and grocery sales will fall 3.8 per cent in 2016, 4.1 per cent in 2017 and 2.1 per cent in 2018, reducing its market share from 14 per cent in 2015 to 10.3 per cent by 2020.
Ge\u00e7ti\u011fimiz hafta, Magellan Fin: Last week, leading fund manager Hamish Douglass, the founder of Magellan Financial Group, told a business lunch in Melbourne that Metcash could "highly, probably disappear within a decade.
Metcash, Bay Douglass'\u0131n yorumlar\u: Metcash has declined to respond publicly to Mr Douglass' comments.
Ancak bir Metcash kurul \u00fcyesinin ge: But it is understood that a Metcash board member contacted Mr Douglass last week.
IGA'n\u0131n pazar pay\u0131 2010'dan be: IGA's market share has fallen from 18 per cent to 14 per cent since 2010 and earnings from Metcash's food and grocery business, which supplies about 1200 IGA retailers, have fallen 43 per cent since 2012, reflecting operating deleverage as sales and margins come under pressure.
Ancak toptanc\u0131 direniyor, Coles ve: However, the wholesaler is fighting back, investing more than $150 million a year matching shelf prices at Coles and Woolworths on hundreds of products each week, helping IGA retailers refurbish stores by adding faster-growing fresh food, and rolling out a better range of private label groceries.
Metcash icra kurulu ba\u015fkan\u0131 Ia: Metcash chief executive Ian Morrice says the price matching and store refurbishment programs are gaining traction and is hoping the wholesaler will return to underlying profit growth in 2017, for the first time in four years.
Thanasi Kokkinakis, Tennis Australia ba\: Thanasi Kokkinakis backed by Tennis Australia president Steve Healy
Thanasi Kokkinakis davran\u0131\u015f\u0: Thanasi Kokkinakis deserves kudos rather than criticism for his behaviour.
Tennis Australia ba\u015fkan\u0131 Steve: Thanasi Kokkinakis has been the collateral damage in the recent storm around his friend Nick Kyrgios and deserves kudos rather than criticism for his own behaviour, according to Tennis Australia president Steve Healy.
Normalde \"\u00d6zel K'ler\" olarak an\u: Kokkinakis, the younger of the talented duo regularly referred to as the "Special Ks," was dragged into an unwelcome spotlight by the infamous Kyrgios sledge of Stan Wawrinka at the Montreal Masters.
Cincinnati'de \u00f6\u011fleden sonra oy: In a fiery qualifying match in Cincinnati soon after, Kokkinakis and his opponent Ryan Harrison twice had to be separated by the chair umpire, with Harrison declaring: "Wawrinka should've decked Kyrgios, and I should deck that kid."
En son US Open'da potansiyel olarak Rich: While he was last seen smashing a racquet after cramp foiled a potential US Open upset of Richard Gasquet, Kokkinakis has been defended staunchly by Healy.
Gen\u00e7 oyuncu \u015fu anda Glasgow'da: The teenager is currently in Glasgow, competing with Sam Groth for the second singles berth behind Bernard Tomic in the Davis Cup semi-final against Britain.
Healy \"Olduk\u00e7a hevesli bir \u015fe: "One thing I do feel quite keenly about is I think Thanasi's been dragged into the fray a little bit," Healy said.
ABD'de \u00f6n\u00fc kapand\u0131\u011f\: He did break a racquet when he lost when he cramped in the US, but he's not the first player to break a racquet out of frustration with himself, and I know Thanasi well enough to know he wouldn't be proud of that.
Ancak ger\u00e7ekte ABD'de, Harrison ve: But, really, he's handled himself extremely well, in pretty provocative circumstances in the US with Harrison and so on, and I think he deserves a lot of credit.
\u00c7evresinde harika bir ekibi, harika: He's a great team around him, he's got a great family around him and I just think he's been a little hard done by.
19 ya\u015f\u0131nda olmas\u0131na ra\u0: He's a very mature 19-year-old, he works very hard, and he fits in with the team and so on, he hasn't ever had an issue with the other players, he's well respected in the locker room, he trains hard, he's in great shape, he's a very stable and mature young guy and I just think he deserves to be judged on his own merits.
Healy ayr\u0131ca \u00f6nemli beraberlik: Healy also backed the decision to overlook Kyrgios for the important tie, starting on Friday, describing the "mutual decision" as the right thing for all, but backing the Canberran to return as a long-term fixture in the team.
Healy, \"Her \u015feyden \u00f6nce tak\u: "First of all we want the team to be completely focused on the tie and not all the controversy around [Kyrgios]," Healy said.
Ve bana g\u00f6re Nick, Federer ve Murra: And I think Nick, he's risen very quickly, as people like Federer and Murray have pointed out, he's growing up in the public eye and he's made some terrible errors and deserves all the criticism he gets, but we're trying to support him, we're trying to help him understand the consequences of his actions, and some time out of the limelight where he can just reflect on that I think is appropriate and it's best for the team and it's best for him.
Avrupa g\u00f6\u00e7men krizi: Macarista: Europe migrant crisis: Hungary declares emergency, seals border, detains migrants
Macaristan, g\u00f6\u00e7men ak\u0131\u0: Declaring a state of emergency, Hungary sealed off its southern border with Serbia on Tuesday and detained those trying to enter illegally, aiming to shut down the flow of migrants pouring in.
Y\u00fczlerce g\u00f6\u00e7menin tarafs\: Chaos ensued at the border, as hundreds of migrants piled up in a no man's land, and Serbian officials reacted with outrage.
Kendi \u00fclkelerindeki \u015fiddetten: Stuck for an unknown amount of time on a strip of road between the two countries' checkpoints, those fleeing violence in their homelands pitched tents and settled in.
Ancak \u00f6fkeleri giderek art\u0131yor: But frustrations were on the rise.
Bir polis helikopteri yukar\u0131dan ge\: As a police helicopter hovered above, migrants chanted "Open the border!" and shouted insults at Hungarian riot police.
Baz\u0131lar\u0131 ise kendilerine veril: Some refused food and water in protest.
S\u0131rbistan D\u0131\u015fi\u015fleri: Serbia's foreign minister declared it was "unacceptable" that migrants were being sent back from Hungary while more and more were arriving from Macedonia and Greece.
(S\u0131rbistan) bu s\u00fcre\u00e7ten z: (Serbia) wants to be part of the solution, not collateral damage.
\u00d6n\u00fcm\u00fczdeki g\u00fcnlerde: There will have to be talks in the coming days with Brussels and other countries," Ivica Dacic said in Prague.
Macaristan-S\u0131rbistan s\u0131n\u0131: The turmoil at the Hungarian-Serbian border came a day after the 28-nation bloc failed to come up with a united immigration policy at a contentious meeting in Brussels.
Bakanlar Yunanistan ve \u0130talya'ya ad: The ministers did agree to share responsibility for 40,000 people seeking refuge in overwhelmed Italy and Greece and spoke hopefully of reaching an eventual deal - next month or by the end of the year - on which EU nations would take 120,000 more refugees, including some from Hungary.
Almanya Ba\u015fbakan\u0131 Angela Merke: German Chancellor Angela Merkel and Austria called Tuesday for a special European Union summit next week to discuss the continent's immigration crisis.
Macaristan ise, Br\u00fcksel'in veya kom: Hungary, however, was not pinning its hopes on any action soon from Brussels or its neighbors.
\u0130ki g\u00fcney b\u00f6lgesinde Sal\: Tuesday's state of emergency in two southern regions gave authorities greater powers to deal with the crisis, allowing them to shut down roads and speed up asylum court cases.
Di\u011fer taraftan, Macaristan D\u0131\: Meanwhile, Hungarian Foreign Minister Peter Szijjarto said his country is also planning to build a razor-wire fence along part of its border with Romania to stop the flow of migrants through the country, now that it has finished a fence on the Serbian border.
CBS News muhabiri Charlie D'Agata, Macar: CBS News correspondent Charlie D'Agata reported that even prison inmates were enlisted in the race to finish the razor wire fence between Hungary and Serbia.
Son birka\u00e7 ayd\u0131r Macaristan, A: In the last few months, Hungary has become a major bottleneck and entry point into the European Union for migrants, many of them war refugees from Syria and elsewhere in the Middle East.
Ba\u015fbakan Viktor Orban ise gelen g\u: Prime Minister Viktor Orban, however, has insisted that most arriving are economic migrants seeking a better life, not war refugees entitled to protection - a view sharply at odds with other EU nations, including Germany.
Macaristan'da gece yar\u0131s\u0131 y\u0: The new laws that took effect at midnight in Hungary now make it a crime to cross or damage a 4-meter (13-foot) razor-wire fence the government has built along the southern border with Serbia and also includes longer prison terms for convicted human traffickers.
G\u00fcneydeki Szeged \u015fehrinde gaze: "Due to the situation caused by mass migration, the Hungarian government declares a state of crisis," government spokesman Zoltan Kovacs told reporters in the southern city of Szeged.
Bir konuda fikrimiz \u00e7ok net: S\u013: We are very clear on this: Illegal border crossing is a crime.
Asker konu\u015fland\u0131rman\u0131n he: Technically, parliament must still approve the deployment of the military, expected next week, but Associated Press reporters at the border have seen heavily armed military personnel with vehicles and dogs for days.
Orban'\u0131n yurti\u00e7i g\u00fcvenlik: Gyorgy Bakondi, homeland security adviser to Orban, said authorities caught 45 people trying to cross at the border and 15 deeper in the country.
Dikenli tellere zarar vererek ge\u00e7ti: They got across by damaging the fence, are now in police custody and are being charged with committing offenses under the new laws.
Yetkililer h\u0131zla dikenli telleri on: Authorities are quickly repairing the fence.
Macar yetkililer ayr\u0131ca Sal\u0131 s: Hungarian officials also closed two of seven border crossings with Serbia on Tuesday morning after deploying a train car covered with razor wire to close one of them.
Macarlar\u0131n i\u015flemlerin yap\u013: Chaos enveloped the main border crossing near Roszke, Hungary, as the Hungarians opened a tiny office in a metal container to process people and crowds pressed to squeeze inside.
20 ki\u015fi i\u00e7eri girebildiyse de: About 20 managed to get in, but thousands remained outside.
Ba\u015fka bir grup g\u00f6\u00e7men ise: Another group of migrants blocked the main highway connecting Serbia and Hungary, saying they were refusing food and water until they are allowed to cross into Hungary.
Se\u00e7im 2016: Hillary Clinton'\u0131n: Election 2016: Hillary Clinton's lead over Bernie Sanders cut by half in national poll
Eski D\u0131\u015fi\u015fleri Bakan\u013: Former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton continues to hold a double-digit lead in the Democratic race for the nomination nationally, but Sen. Bernie Sanders is gaining on her.
Clinton \u015fu anda Demoktarik oylar\u0: Clinton now has the backing of 47 percent of Democratic primary voters (down from 58 percent), while Sanders comes in second, with 27 percent (up from 17 percent).
Ba\u015fkanl\u0131k yar\u0131\u015f\u013: Vice President Joe Biden, who has yet to announce whether he is running for president, receives support from 15 percent of Democratic primary voters.
Ana yar\u0131\u015flar\u0131n ba\u015fla: More than five months before the start of the primary contests, most Democratic voters say it is too early to say that their minds are made up about which candidate they will support.
Ancak Clinton'\u0131n destek\u00e7ileri: But Clinton's backers are more firm in their choice than those backing other candidates.
Ge\u00e7en ay ki CBS Haberlerinden beri: Since last month's CBS News Poll, Clinton has lost ground among a number of demographic groups, while Sanders has made some gains.
Clinton kad\u0131nlar ve \u0131l\u0131ml: Clinton maintains a large lead among women and moderates, but those leads have narrowed.
Erkekler aras\u0131ndaki deste\u011fi b\: Her support among men has dropped considerably and Sanders only trails her by 5 points.
Clinton'\u0131n 50 ya\u015f alt\u0131nda: Clinton's advantage with Democratic voters under age 50 has evaporated, and she and Sanders are now even.
Ancak Clinton ya\u015fl\u0131 se\u00e7me: However, Clinton still has a large lead with older voters.
Ge\u00e7en ay Clinton, liberaller aras\u: Last month, Clinton was ahead of Sanders by double-digits among liberals, but Sanders now has a 5-point edge with this group.
Ulusal d\u00fczeyde demokrat se\u00e7men: About half of Democratic primary voters nationwide say they would enthusiastically support Clinton if she became the party's nominee.
Bir \u00e7eyrek baz\u0131 \u015fartlarla: A quarter would support her with some reservations and another 15 percent would only back her because she is the nominee.
Y\u00fczde alt\u0131l\u0131k bir kesim C: Six percent would not support her.
Belki hi\u00e7 de \u015fa\u015f\u0131rt\: Perhaps not surprisingly, Clinton's current supporters are especially likely to be enthusiastic about her.
Clinton'\u0131 \u015fu anda desteklemeye: Views are more mixed among those not currently backing Clinton - only about a quarter would enthusiastically support her.
Demokratlar\u0131n y\u00fczde 48'i tutku: While 48 percent of Democratic primary voters say they would enthusiastically back Clinton, fewer Republican voters say that about their frontrunner, Donald Trump (35 percent).
Clinton'\u0131n destek\u00e7ilerine nede: When Clinton's supporters are asked in an open-ended question why they want her to be the nominee, the top answer is that she has the right experience (16 percent), followed by it's time for a woman president (13 percent), and that she is the best candidate for the job (10 percent).
Clinton'\u0131n destek\u00e7ileri ayr\u0: Also mentioned by Clinton supporters is her association with Bill Clinton (9 percent).
Sorunlarda uzla\u015fmac\u0131 olmak ve: Agreement on the issues, and electability are also cited.
Ba\u015fkanl\u0131k i\u00e7in potansiyel: As the vice president weighs a potential run for president, 57 percent of Democratic primary voters would like to see him jump in the race - although a third don't think he should.
Demoktrat se\u00e7menlere parti i\u00e7i: When Democratic primary voters are asked who would be their second choice for the party's nomination, Biden is the top pick.
Clinton'\u0131n destekleyenlerin yar\u01: Among Clinton supporters, more than half say Biden would be their second choice, far ahead of Sanders.
Biden, Demokrat Adayl\u0131k yar\u0131\u: If Biden chooses not to run for the Democratic nomination, Hillary Clinton's lead over Sanders widens, from 20 points with Biden in the race to 30 points without him in the running.
Demokrat se\u00e7menlerin y\u00fczde ell: Fifty-five percent of Democratic voters see Clinton as the candidate with the best chance of winning the general election; however that figure is down from 78 percent last month.
Biden bu a\u00e7\u0131ndan bak\u0131ld\u: Biden is a distant second on this measure, but the percentage that sees him as the most electable has risen.
Yine bir adaydaki en \u00f6nemli \u015fe: Still, when asked which is more important in a nominee, Democratic voters pick issues over electability.
Ge\u00e7en aya benzer \u015fekilde hi\u0: Similar to last month, no single Democratic candidate or potential candidate stands out as unacceptable as the nominee to these primary voters.
Demokratik adaylar ya da aday adaylar\u0: The Democratic candidates, or potential candidates, perform well on some key characteristics among their party's primary voters.
\u00c7o\u011funluk Clinton, Sanders ve B: Majorities see Clinton, Sanders and Biden as honest and trustworthy and as having strong leadership qualities.
Biden d\u00fcr\u00fcstl\u00fck a\u00e7\u: Biden does the best of the three on honesty, while Clinton's strength is leadership.
Demokrat se\u00e7menlerin y\u00fczde otu: Thirty percent of Democratic primary voters don't think Clinton is honest and trustworthy, twice as many as say that about Sanders (15 percent), but 27 percent don't have an opinion of him on this.
Demokrat se\u00e7menler ayr\u0131ca gene: Democratic primary voters also generally see Clinton, Sanders and Biden as in line with their views ideologically.
T\u00fcm \u00f6l\u00e7\u00fctlerde Demok: On all of these measures, about a quarter of Democratic voters do not have an opinion of Sanders.
D\u0131\u015fi\u015fleri Bakanl\u0131\u0: As questions continue about Hillary Clinton's use of a personal email address and server while Secretary of State, most Democratic primary voters are satisfied with her explanation of the matter and say it hasn't impacted their overall views of her.
Ama bu, genel Amerikan kamuoyunda farkl\: But it's a different story among the American public overall.
Amerikal\u0131lar\u0131n yar\u0131s\u013: Half of Americans are now dissatisfied with her explanation, while just about a third are satisfied.
Halk\u0131n bu konudaki g\u00f6r\u00fc\u: The public's views on this were split back in March, shortly after the issue came to light.
\u00c7o\u011fu Amerikal\u0131 e-posta \u: Most Americans say the email controversy has had no effect on their overall opinions of Clinton, although 36 percent say their opinion of her has grown worse.
Bunlar genel olarak Cumhuriyet\u00e7iler: It is mainly Republicans, more than six in 10, who say their views of Clinton have become worse.
Clinton her ne kadar kendi partisinin se: Even though Clinton is viewed as honest and trustworthy by her party's voters, this continues to be a problem for her among registered voters overall: only 32 percent see her as honest and trustworthy, down eight points from last month, and 15 points since May.
Kay\u0131tl\u0131 se\u00e7menlerin y\u00: Sixty-two percent of registered voters don't think of her as honest and trustworthy.
Ayn\u0131 zamanda t\u00fcm \u00fclkede k: At the same time, 55 percent of registered voters nationwide don't see Trump as honest and trustworthy either.
Bununla birlikte hem Clinton hem Trump l: Both Clinton and Trump, however, get good marks on leadership.
Teste kat\u0131lan alt\u0131 aday aras\u: Of the six candidates tested, Biden, Carson and Bush do the best on honesty.
Daha fazlas\u0131 Sanders'\u0131 \u00e7o: More see Sanders as honest than not, but like Carson, many don't have an opinion of him.
351 Demokrat se\u00e7menden al\u0131nan: The margin of error for the sample of 351 Democratic primary voters is 6 percentage points.
Ben Carson ulusal anketlerde Donald Trum: Ben Carson draws close behind Donald Trump in national poll
En yeni CBS News/New York Times anketine: Ben Carson is running close behind Donald Trump in the newest CBS News/New York Times poll
Yeni anket, iki aday\u0131n se\u00e7menl: The two candidates account for half the support of voters in the new poll, leaving others scrounging for a foothold
\u00dclke \u00e7ap\u0131ndaki Cumhuriyet: Republican voters nationwide continue to back Trump in large numbers, climbing from 23% support in the last CBS poll, conducted before the Fox News debate last month, to 27% in the poll out Tuesday.
Ancak Carson'a olan destek ayn\u0131 d\u: But Carson rocketed in that same period from 6% to 23%.
Anket ayr\u0131ca Carson'un demografik g: The survey also found Carson doing well across demographic groups, edging out Trump among college-educated Republican voters.
Kalanlar, Carly Fiorina ve Ohio Valisi J: The rest of the field, with the exception of Carly Fiorina and Ohio Gov. John Kasich, has slipped behind with Wisconsin Gov. Scott Walker falling farthest from 10% support last month to 2% now.
Eski Florida Valisi Jeb Bush, Eski Arkan: Former Florida Gov. Jeb Bush, former Arkansas Gov. Mike Huckabee and Florida Sen. Marco Rubio all tied for third place with 6%.
Cumhuriyet\u00e7i se\u00e7menler aras\u0: The margin of error for the 376-person sample of Republican voters in this newest poll is plus-or-minus 6%, and was conducted Sept.
Ge\u00e7ti\u011fimiz hafta yay\u0131nlan: The latest CNN/ORC survey, released last week, showed Carson rising in the polls -- landing at 19% support among Republicans, behind Trump's 32% support.
ABC News/Washington Post taraf\u0131ndan: The latest poll from ABC News/Washington Post also showed Trump significantly ahead of Carson.
Ge\u00e7ti\u011fimiz hafta Carson'un y\u: Facing a rising Carson last week, Trump took some potshots at the retired neurosurgeon, even as Carson apologized for questioning Trump's faith.

Fed faiz oranlar\u0131n\u0131 art\u0131r: Here's what will happen when the Fed raises interest rates
Faiz oranlar\u0131n\u0131n y\u00fckselme: A rate hike will come and the bull market will stumble, bond yields will climb and the economy will slip into a recession.

Tarih, \u00f6zellikle ekonomide, zamanla: For the economy specifically, history offers little guide about timing.
Gerileme, ilk faiz oran\u0131 art\u0131\: A recession has come as quickly as 11 months after the first rate hike and as long as 86 months.
ABD Merkez Bankas\u0131 Fed'in faiz oran: The Federal Reserve's aggressiveness in raising rates is often, though not always, a determinant in how the economy and financial assets respond.
ABD merkez bankas\u0131 yetkililerinin y: That's why officials at the U.S. central bank have stressed so vigorously that investors should not be focused on when it starts raising rates but rather the trajectory of how long it will take to normalize.
\u00c7e\u015fitli de\u011fi\u015fkenleri: There are, indeed, multiple variables at play.
Ancak netice, piyasa kat\u0131l\u0131mc\: In the end, however, market participants may find that all the rate-hike fuss may have been overdone.
Capital Economics K\u00fcresel Ba\u015fe: "The first hike from the Fed since the global financial crisis will inevitably be interpreted by some as signaling the end of the era of 'cheap money,' " Julian Jessop, chief global economist at Capital Economics, said in a note to clients.
Aksine, ABD faiz oranlar\u0131n\u0131n y: In contrast, we do not expect the gradual return of U.S. interest rates to more normal but still low levels to be the seismic shock that many seem to fear.
That's not to say there won't be effects, however.
Ge\u00e7mi\u015f trendlere dayanarak, ek: Here's a look at how some areas of the economy could react, based on historical trends:
Piyasada ge\u00e7mi\u015f aylarda da g\u: As the market has seen over the past month or so, anticipation of rate hikes can make things volatile for a while.
Faiz artt\u0131r\u0131ld\u0131\u011f\u01: Once the hike hits, though, the impact is not as dramatic.
Fed art\u0131r\u0131mlar\u0131ndan sonra: "It does seem there is a trend for equity returns to stall 12-24 months after the first hike, which again perhaps reflects the lag in monetary policy," Deutsche Bank analysts said in a recent study of what happens after the Fed hikes.
Nuveen Varl\u0131k Y\u00f6netimi analist: More specifically, the market over the past 35 years or so is most often up sharply - about 14 percent - heading into the rate hike, fairly flat in the 250 days after (average gain of 2.6 percent) then back to normal once 500 days have passed, with average return in the past six cycles of 14.4 percent, according to a recent analysis Bob Doll, chief equity strategist at Nuveen Asset Management, posted on Barron's.
Deutsche, hisseler \u00fczerindeki etkin: Deutsche said the impact on stocks tends to get more pronounced later in the rate-hiking cycle and returns begin to diminish.
Gerilemeler ekonomik hayat\u0131n bir ge: Recessions are a fact of economic life, but rate hikes often help them along.
Fed, g\u00fcncel durumda, daha \u00f6nce: In the current case, the Fed is facing some conditions that did not exist before and could hasten a recession.
En dikkat \u00e7ekeni ise gayri safi yur: Most notably, gross domestic product will be near its lowest point ever for a Fed rate hike.
Deutsche Bank'a g\u00f6re, 1950'den bu y: According to Deutsche Bank, in the 118 rate hikes since 1950, only twice has nominal year over year GDP been below 4.5 percent.
Her ne kadar 2015 y\u0131l\u0131n\u0131n: Even though the second quarter of 2015 was at 3.6 percent, few expect that to last, with the third quarter tracking at just 1.5 percent, according to the Atlanta Fed.
Deutsche'ye g\u00f6re, faiz oranlar\u013: Hiking rates into such a fragile economic backdrop could be risky and set up the question of "whether this time is different," Deutsche said.
Bir senedir Fed'in faiz art\u0131r\u0131: Market participants have been bracing for a Fed hike all year, with all eyes turned toward this week's Federal Open Market Committee meeting, which ends Thursday.
\u00c7o\u011fu strateji uzman\u0131 ile: While many strategists and economists believe the FOMC could approve a hike at this meeting, futures trading indicates just a 25 percent probability.
Raporda, \"1950'den bu yana yapt\u0131\u: "In our study since 1950, all hiking cycles to date have been in a super cycle of increasing leverage with GDP eclipsing prerecession peaks very quickly post the recovery commencing," the report said.
Aksine, bu, \u00f6rnek bir d\u00f6nemde: By contrast this has been a uniquely slow recovery from what was the worst recession in the sample period.
G\u00fcncel d\u00f6ng\u00fc, Fed'in son: The current cycle is by far the longest the Fed has waited since the end of the last recession; the record had been 35 months, and this is 74 months and counting.
Piyasada faiz art\u0131\u015f\u0131 bekl: Fixed income also has been volatile as the market anticipates a rate hike, and the pattern is somewhat similar to what equities experience.
As\u0131l fark, Fed politikas\u0131n\u01: The principal difference is that the impact happens faster in bonds than stocks when the Fed changes course in policy.
D\u00f6ng\u00fcn\u00fcn ilk art\u0131\u0: For bonds, it does seem yields change direction immediately as the first hike/cut in the cycle arrives.
Faiz art\u0131r\u0131m\u0131 d\u00f6ng\u: At the end of the hiking cycle bond yields fall immediately," Deutsche said.
Charles Schwab strateji uzmanlar\u0131na: Charles Schwab strategists believe the hike in rates will cause yields between longer- and shorter-dated bonds to move closer together, flattening the curve.
Biz analizde y\u00fcksek getirili tahvil: High-yield bonds often perform better in such a climate, though "we are still cautious about stretching for yield," Kathy Jones, fixed income analyst at Schwab, said in an analysis.
\u0130lgin\u00e7 \u015fekilde, Jones piy: Interestingly, Jones thinks markets already have adapted to Fed policy expectations.
\"Dolar\u0131n g\u00fcc\u00fc ve enflasy: "In addition to the strength in the dollar and the drop in inflation expectations, there are several signs that the market has adjusted to the prospect of tighter monetary policy," she wrote.
K\u0131sa vadeli faizler art\u0131yor, v: Short-term interest rates are up, the yield curve is flatter, credit spreads have widened and volatility has increased - all characteristics of the market when the Fed tightens policy.
Geni\u015f a\u00e7\u0131dan bak\u0131ld\: Broadly speaking, companies that do the majority of their business in the U.S. will win as interest rates rise and local products become more attractive.
\u00c7ok borcu olan \u00e7ok uluslu \u01: Multinationals with lots of debt will fare worse, as a rising dollar makes their products more expensive in the global market space and their debt more expensive the finance.
Goldman Sachs analistleri m\u00fc\u015ft: "History shows that 'quality' stocks tend to outperform during the three months following an initial rate hike," Goldman Sachs analysts said in a report for clients.
G\u00fc\u00e7l\u00fc bilan\u00e7olara sa: Firms with strong balance sheets outpaced weak balance sheet companies following each of the 1994, 1999, and 2004 rate hikes, by an average of 5 percentage points.
Y\u00fcksek sermaye getirili ve d\u00fc\: Companies with high returns on capital as well as low volatility stocks also outperformed their lower quality counterparts, by an average of 4 (percentage points) and 3 (percentage points), respectively.

Goldman'a g\u00f6re, y\u00fcksek oranda: Companies with a high percentage of floating rate debt stand to lose the most, Goldman said.
Safi borsa oyunu haricinde, t\u00fcketic: Outside pure stock plays, consumers stand to benefit as well through the rising dollar.
Her ne kadar uzmanlar ne kadar h\u0131zl: Savers could see gains as well through higher yields at the, though experts differ on how quickly that will take hold.

\u00c7ocuk bak\u0131m\u0131na y\u00f6nel: Asked by a provider of holiday childcare schemes to name his favourite kids' book, the prime minister opted for The Lorax, the 1971 environmental fable by Dr Seuss.

Buraya kadar her \u015fey gayet iyi gidi: All very well, except that the subsequent paragraph in which Cameron supposedly describes the plot of the book instead gives a précis of the 2012 film version, which added new characters and detail to pad out the fairly brief original text.
T\u00fcm do\u011fan\u0131n yok oldu\u011: "Set in the walled city of Thneed-Ville, where all nature has gone and even the air is a commodity, a boy named Ted hopes to win the heart of his dream girl, Audrey, by fulfilling her wish to see a real tree," it reads, chronicling a love interest unknown to Dr Seuss, real name Theodor Seuss Geisel, who died in 1991.

\u0130\u015finin ehli bir ebeveyn oldu\u: Given he is an avowedly hands-on parent, it seems unlikely Cameron is so unfamiliar with the book's plot, in which a young unnamed boy hears how the local environment was devastated by the avaricious, tree-chopping, thneed-knitting Once-ler, despite the protests of the eponymous Lorax, a squat, moustachioed creature who "speaks for the trees."
B\u00fcy\u00fck ihtimalle bu denli zay\u: Most likely, such a relatively lowly PR task would have been outsourced to an aide, seemingly one who has never read The Lorax 20 times in a row to a child.

SuperCamps metnin Cameron'un personelind: SuperCamps confirmed that the text was provided from Cameron's staff, but had no further immediate comment.

Uzmanlar \u0130ngiltere Kamu Sa\u011fl\u: Experts criticise Public Health England e-cigarettes review
Ara\u015ft\u0131rmac\u0131lar, h\u00fck\: Claims by a government-funded agency that e-cigarettes are 95% less harmful than smoking arose from a meeting of 12 people, some with links to the tobacco industry, researchers have said.
Britanyal\u0131 T\u0131p Dergisi'nde (BM: Experts writing in the British Medical Journal (BMJ) joined the Lancet in criticising the evidence used by Public Health England (PHE) in its report on e-cigarettes.
PHE, \"delillerin ayr\u0131nt\u0131l\u01: PHE published the "landmark" report last month, describing it as a "comprehensive review of the evidence."
Fakat baz\u0131 ara\u015ft\u0131rmac\u01: But several researchers have questioned the robustness of the data and pointed to links between some experts and the tobacco industry.
Lancet t\u0131p dergisinin ge\u00e7en ay: An editorial in the Lancet medical journal last month attacked the "extraordinarily flimsy foundation" on which PHE based its main conclusion.
BMJ'de yazan ba\u015fka iki ara\u015ft\u: Writing in the BMJ, two further researchers have questioned whether the claims were "built on rock or sand."
Londra Hijyen ve Tropikal T\u0131p Okulu: Martin McKee, professor of European public health at the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine, and Simon Capewell, professor of clinical epidemiology at the University of Liverpool, said: "A fundamental principle of public health is that policies should be based on evidence of effectiveness."
Kamunun PHE'nin \"mevcut en iyi tahmine: They said the public would expect PHE's claims that "the current best estimate is that e-cigarettes are around 95% less harmful than smoking" would be based on a detailed review of evidence and modelling.
Asl\u0131nda bu nikotin i\u00e7eren de\u: In fact, it comes from a single meeting of 12 people convened to develop a multi-criteria decision analysis (MCDA) model to synthesise their opinions on the harms associated with different nicotine-containing products; the results of the meeting were summarised in a research paper.
McKee ve Capewell, toplant\u0131n\u0131n: McKee and Capewell said one sponsor of the meeting was a company called EuroSwiss Health, whose chief executive was reported to have previously received funding from British American Tobacco for an independent study.
Onun ayr\u0131ca bir s\u00fcrd\u00fcr\u0: He also endorsed BAT's public health credentials in a sustainability report, they said.
Toplant\u0131daki 12 ki\u015fiden birini: One of the 12 people at the meeting declared funding from an e-cigarette manufacturer but not the funding he was reported to have received previously from the tobacco company Philip Morris International, they added.
Panel \u00fcyelerinin nas\u0131l se\u00e: The rationale for selecting the members of the panel is not provided, but they include several known e-cigarette champions, some of whom also declare industry funding in the paper.
Toplant\u0131da haz\u0131r bulunan di\u0: Some others present at the meeting are not known for their expertise in tobacco control.
Toplant\u0131ya PHE'de t\u00fct\u00fcn s: The meeting was also attended by the tobacco lead at PHE.
McKee ve Capewell, grubun yazd\u0131\u01: The research paper produced by the group "tellingly concedes" there is a lack of "hard evidence for the harms of most products on most of the criteria," McKee and Capewell wrote.
Ancak bu ba\u011flant\u0131lar\u0131n ve: However, none of these links or limitations are discussed in the PHE report.
MCKee ve Capewell, \"e-sigaran\u0131n \u: McKee and Capewell said PHE's claims that "there is no evidence so far that e-cigarettes are acting as a route into smoking for children or non-smokers" were premature.
PHE'de sa\u011fl\u0131k ve refah direkt\: Prof Kevin Fenton, director of health and wellbeing at PHE, said the claims in the BMJ had been responded to before.
\u015e\u00f6yle dedi: \"E-sigaralar siga: He said: "E-cigarettes are significantly less harmful than smoking."
\u00d6m\u00fcr boyu sigara tiryakisi ola: One in two lifelong smokers dies from their addiction.
B\u00fct\u00fcn deliller e-sigaralar\u01: All of the evidence suggests that the health risks posed by e-cigarettes are small by comparison, but we must continue to study the long-term effects.
PHE'nin net bir vazifesi var: kamuyu, bi: PHE has a clear duty to inform the public about what the evidence shows and what it does not show, especially when there was so much public confusion about the relative dangers compared to tobacco.
Y\u0131lda neredeyse 80.000 ki\u015fi si: Nearly 80,000 people a year die of a smoking-related illness and smoking costs the NHS £2bn a year.
Mevcut delilleri - e-sigaran\u0131n risk: By spelling out clearly the current evidence - that while e-cigarettes are not risk-free, they carry only a fraction of the harm caused by smoking - we are fulfilling our national remit.
\u00d6nceki Channel 4 \u015fefi BBC'nin: BBC should give up EastEnders, says former Channel 4 chief
\u00d6nceki Channel 4 ba\u015fkan\u0131: The former Channel 4 chairman Luke Johnson has said the BBC should stop broadcasting programmes such as EastEnders and The Voice, saying its commercial rivals would "give their right arm" for hit shows such as the Albert Square soap.
Johnson, lisans \u00fccretinin yaln\u013: Johnson said the licence fee should only be used to make the sort of programmes that are not made by other UK broadcasters.
BBC'yi, de\u011ferli aral\u0131klarda ra: He criticised the BBC for putting public service programmes likely to be watched by a smaller audience in tough slots against its rivals" biggest rating shows, and on channels such as BBC4.
BBC'nin genel direkt\u00f6r\u00fc Tony H: After the BBC's director general, Tony Hall, said the corporation wanted to do more in partnership with other organisations, Johnson said he had tried for six years in his time at Channel 4 to do a tie-up with the BBC without success.
Johnson, BBC'nin gelece\u011fine ili\u01: "I do struggle with the idea that the BBC commissions and broadcasts programmes that would clearly be shown by unsubsidised rivals," Johnson told the House of Lords communication committee, as part of its inquiry into the future of the BBC.
Orta ya da uzun vadede iyi bir fikir old: If you keep the licence fee, which I'm not sure in the medium or long term is a good idea, it should reduce its output at least to programmes that others aren't making and commissioning.
The Voice'u primetime aral\u0131\u011f\u: They broadcast The Voice in a prime slot because they want to gain as broad a support as possible for its future.
Buradaki ana fikir ba\u015fka kimsenin y: The idea that no one else would show that is a joke, it's ludicrous, it's obviously nonsense.
Johnson \u015f\u00f6yle dedi: \"Yard\u01: Johnson said: "I don't see why a regressive tax should fund programmes that could be funded without subsidy.
The Voice bir tanesi ise EastEnders da b: The Voice is one, EastEnders is another, admittedly made in-house.
D\u00fcr\u00fcst olmak gerekirse di\u011: Frankly other channels would give their right arm for it.
Kamu hizmeti yay\u0131nlar\u0131n\u0131n: I struggle to see how it's public service broadcasting.
Bunun BBC'yi hi\u00e7 de eksiltece\u011f: I don't think that would diminish the BBC at all.
Channel 4'\u00fc 2004'ten 2010'a kadar y: Johnson, a serial entrepreneur who led Channel 4 from 2004 to 2010, said the BBC was guilty of chasing ratings "because of the ambitions of people who work there, and because they believe that is the best way to secure long-term support."
BBC'nin en pop\u00fcler programlar\u0131: His comments about the BBC's most popular shows echo those of former Sky executive Tony Ball, who used his MacTaggart lecture in Edinburgh in 2003 to propose that the BBC sell off shows such as EastEnders.
Johnson BBC'nin daha uygun kamu hizmeti: Johnson said the BBC's more niche public service programmes "go on to BBC4 where quite often you can't measure the audience but they fulfil their remit and they can argue when they go on their sanctimonious missions about justifying £4bn in licence fee income, "Well of course, we do all these obscure programmes that no one watched."
Bunlar\u0131 kimsenin hi\u00e7bir zaman: They put them on a slot where no one was ever going to watch them.
Lisans \u00fccreti hakk\u0131nda, Johnso: On the licence fee, Johnson told the committee: "I challenge you to find a more regressive system in terms of who gets the best value from it.
Tabi ki hepiniz d\u00fc\u015f\u00fcn\u00: Of course you all think, we all think, £150 a year is great value, but for people for whom £150 is a lot of money I wonder if they do because they don't consume a lot of the BBC.
Ayn\u0131 zamanda Sal\u0131 g\u00fcn\u00: Former Sky and Channel 5 executive David Elstein, who also gave evidence to the committee on Tuesday, said the BBC should revise its Reithian mission to "inform, educate and entertain."
BBC'nin \u00e7\u0131k\u0131\u015f\u0131n: He said little of the BBC's output was now formally classified as education - he said it was 1% of its TV output and 0.1% on radio - and it should take a lead from public service broadcasters in Australia and Canada and change it to "inform, enlighten and entertain."
Ortakl\u0131klar konusunda, Elstein, BBC: On the issue of partnerships, Elstein said the BBC should do more in areas such as the Proms, of which he said only a handful were shown on TV, and enter into alliances with commercial broadcasters to make them all available to watch online.
'Sonogenetik' beyin h\u00fccrelerinin se: 'Sonogenetics' allows brain cells to be controlled by sound waves
Videoda iplik kurtlar\u0131n\u0131n ses: The video shows how the nematodes change direction the moment they are blasted with sonic pulses.
Bilim insanlar\u0131 ses dalgas\u0131 pa: Scientists have bred worms with genetically modified nervous systems that can be controlled by bursts of sound waves.
Minik iplik kurtlar\u0131 insanlar\u0131: The tiny nematodes change direction the moment they are blasted with sonic pulses that are too high-pitched for humans to hear.
Titre\u015fimler ses \u00f6tesi dalgalar: The pulses work by switching on motor neuron cells that are genetically modified to carry membrane channels that respond to ultrasonic waves.
\u0130lgili: Ara\u015ft\u0131rmac\u0131l: Related: Researchers read and write brain activity with light
Ara\u015ft\u0131rmac\u0131lar kurt\u00e7: Researchers said the worms demonstrate the power of a new procedure, dubbed sonogenetics, in which ultrasound can be used to activate a range of brain, heart and muscle cells from outside the body.
Kaliforniya, La Jolla'da bulunan Salk In: Sreekanth Chalasani, a researcher at the Salk Institute in La Jolla, California, told the Guardian that the procedure could one day replace deep-brain stimulation, an invasive procedure that delivers electrical pulses into people's brains to treat symptoms of Parkinson's disease.
\u0130plik kurtlar\u0131 \u00e7o\u011fun: Nematode worms do not usually react to ultrasound, but Chalasani found that they did when they were surrounded by a fluid containing microscopic bubbles.
Buldu\u011fu kabarc\u0131klar ses \u00f6: The bubbles, he found, amplify the ultrasonic waves which then pass inside the worms.
G\u00fc\u00e7lendirilmi\u015f ses \u00f6: The amplified ultrasound waves act on structures called TRP-4 ion channels, found in the membranes of some of the worms" cells.
Nature Communications'da yay\u0131nlanan: The sound waves make these ion channels open up and activate the cells they are attached to, according to a report in Nature Communications.
Ses \u00f6tesi ile kontrol edilen iplik: To make ultrasound-controlled nematodes, Chalasani genetically modified the worms so that some of their motor neurons carried TRP-4 ion channels.
De\u011fi\u015ftirilen yarat\u0131klara: When he applied ultrasound to the modified creatures, the sound waves were amplified by the microbubbles and transmitted into the worms, where they switched on the modified motor neurons.
Bu prosed\u00fcr, bilim insanlar\u0131n\: The procedure has some similarities with optogenetics, a groundbreaking tool that allows scientists to switch neurons on and off with pulses of light.
Ama Chalasani sonogeneti\u011fin bu tekn: But Chalasani said that sonogenetics could have some advantages over that technique.
Beyin i\u00e7inde istenen noktaya bir op: Unlike light, which has to be sent down an optic fibre to the desired location inside the brain, low frequency ultrasound waves can pass through tissue unhindered, and so can be sent into the brain from on top of the skull.
Chalasani \"gen terapisi ve tedavi edici: "We believe that, using gene therapy and a therapeutic virus, it may be possible to make target human neurons temporarily susceptible to the ultrasound signal in a clinical setting for certain neurological treatments," said Chalasani.
Di\u011fer uygulamalar\u0131n kas h\u00f: Other applications could focus on muscle cells and insulin-producing cells, he added.
Yasa d\u0131\u015f\u0131 i\u015fkence ek: Illegal torture equipment - right on your doorstep!
Reklamlar \u0130ngiltere'nin silah ticar: The adverts shaming Britain's arms trade
Uluslararas\u0131 Af \u00d6rg\u00fct\u00: Watch Amnesty International's anti-arms fair video.
Ve \u015fiddetli ac\u0131ya neden olan a: And electric stun batons that cause excruciating pain but leave no trace!
Uluslararas\u0131 Af \u00d6rg\u00fct\u00: The cheery voice and cartoon imagery leave no doubt that this advert for the world's biggest arms fair is a sharp spoof, produced for Amnesty International to highlight the British government's willingness to flog weapons to repressive regimes via the Defence and Security Equipment International's jamboree at the ExCeL Centre in London's Docklands.
\u0130lgili: DSEI silah fuar\u0131: otor: Related: DSEI weapons fair: authoritarian regimes descend on London
Ancak farkl\u0131 bir kampanya da otob\u: But a separate campaign is also leading to many posters cropping up at bus stops and on tube trains that require a second glance.
Biririnde, Londra Metrosu fontlar\u0131n: "Important announcement, Travelling on the DLR from 15th to 18th September?" reads one, using London Underground fonts and branding with the DLR line turning into the image of a tank.
Bu Eyl\u00fcl, bir silah sat\u0131c\u013: This September, a swarm of arms dealers will be descending on the DLR ... Customers are requested to help stop the arms fair.
300 poster, Bansky'nin Dismaland'indeki: The 300 posters are by artists who exhibited work at the Museum of Cruel Designs in Banksy's Dismaland.
\u00d6zel Devriye Grubu ad\u0131 verilen: A collective called the Special Patrol Group helped distribute it around London using "Ad Space Hack Packs," a £6 pack of Allen keys which it claims "gain access to around a third of bus stop advertising space on the planet."
Londra i\u00e7in Ula\u015f\u0131m bu afi: Transport for London is not amused by this flyposting "vandalism."
Reklamlardan bir tanesi \u00d6zel Devriy: One of the spoof ads produced by the Special Patrol Group collective.
Zalim Tasar\u0131mlar k\u00fcrat\u00f6r\: According to Gavin Grindon, curator of Cruel Designs and a lecturer at the University of Essex, artists are becoming more questioning and seeking to take political work to audiences outside galleries.
Pek \u00e7ok sanat\u00e7\u0131 protesto: A lot of artists are moving to work with activists within protest movements, realising they have to get out in the real world for their art to have an impact on society.
Bir di\u011fer silah ticareti kar\u015f\: Another of the anti-arms trade posters greeting commuters on the tube.
Uluslararas\u0131 Af \u00d6rg\u00fct\u00: The Amnesty video has been watched more than 100,000 times in 24 hours via Facebook and was created by ad agency VCCP working pro bono, with the graphic designer and voiceover artist also working for free.
VCCP yarat\u0131c\u0131 y\u00f6netmeni M: VCCP creative director Matt Lever was struck by the silence surrounding the advertising of the arms fair - with a blank space on ExCeL's calendar - and thought: "Let's give them the campaign they are trying to avoid."
Daha ger\u00e7ek\u00e7i, kurnazca bir ku: They toyed with creating a more realistic dodgy corporate advert, but "by ramming it home with bright colours and animation, it was more arresting."
Af \u00d6rg\u00fct\u00fc'nden Tom Davies: "They've done a fantastic job in helping us raise concerns about the selling of illegal torture equipment at the fair," says Tom Davies at Amnesty.
\u015eimdi ihtiyac\u0131m\u0131z olan \u: What we need now is for the UK government to take action and ensure that torture equipment is not illegally traded on our doorstep.
Belki de silah fuar\u0131ndaki en yarat\: Perhaps the most creative art surrounding the arms fair comes from inside ExCeL, where exhibitors flog fantastically euphemistic products.
Bir bas\u0131n a\u00e7\u0131klamas\u0131: In a press release, Saab revealed an order from the US army for "the shoulder-launched AT4CS RS."
Bunun i\u00e7inde \"benzersiz bi\u00e7im: This includes a "unique shaped-charge warhead that delivers outstanding behind-armour-effects inside the target."
Her ne yap\u0131yorsa bu ho\u015f olmaya: Whatever that does, it won't be pleasant.
\u00d6\u011frenci yurtlar\u0131nda ya\u0: Eight golden rules for living in student halls
\u0130lgisiz bir 19 ya\u015f\u0131nda ge: It's been 11 years since I moved into student halls as an oblivious 19-year-old, still believing in berets and moral relativism, but it's only now I recall the strained smiles of those I annoyed - and the numerous, lengthy complaints about others.
\u00d6\u011frendiklerimin \u00e7o\u011fu: Most of what I learned can be distilled into eight simple rules.
Yurda ta\u015f\u0131nmak sinir bozuculuk: Moving into halls can range from mildly nerve-racking to totally terrifying.
Gevezeli\u011fin ba\u015ftan \u00e7\u013: It's tempting to babble: telling people where you're from, whether and where you took a gap year, where you stand on Corbyn and why you "honestly neither love nor hate Marmite because seriously guys it's just yeast extract HAHAHA I'll be in my room."
Ve di\u011ferlerinin de bir tane almas\u: And help others take one too - ask questions and show interest.
Bu konu\u015fmay\u0131 y\u00f6nlendirece: It steers the conversation and helps you to scout out the people you like versus those you wouldn't talk to even if your eyelashes were on fire and they were dispensing extinguishers.
\u0130nsanlar\u0131n odalar\u0131 s\u013: People's rooms often morph into drinks receptions, movie-night venues and communal hangout spots, but they're also where people get dressed and adjust their underwear.
\u0130lgili: \u00dcniversiteye bir ili\u: Related: Don't even think about starting university in a relationship
\u0130\u00e7e d\u00f6n\u00fckler \u00dcn: Introverts get a raw deal at university.
Odan\u0131z inziva yeri olabilir, fakat: Your room should be a retreat, yet many halls form an inter-room-strolling culture that's friendly, social and conducive to lifelong friendships.
Bu enerji depolamaya \u00e7al\u0131\u015: That can be hell for someone who's trying to recharge.
K\u00fclt\u00fcrde hi\u00e7bir \u015fey: Nothing in the culture allows you to say, "I like you and I want our friendship to continue, but I need you to go away so I can get back the energy I've expended on interacting with you."
Bir arkada\u015f\u0131n\u0131z\u0131n so: Try to sense when a fellow student is exhausted from socialising - and maybe text instead of knocking.
\u00d6\u011frenci yurdundaki bir arkada\: One guy in my student halls had a policy that if a door wasn't locked he was invited in.
Yemek yar\u0131\u015fmas\u0131 \u00e7\u0: Since you're starting uni at the height of Bake-Off mania, knocking on people's doors to introduce yourself with a plate of brownies seems marginally less weird, less 1950s "Welcome to the neighbourhood, I baked you something, now smile as I ask you personal questions."
\u0130nsanlara ev yap\u0131m\u0131 ikram: Offering homemade treats is a great way to make friends.
Ev arkada\u015flar\u0131n konu\u015fmaya: Your housemates will feel obliged to chat, and may end up associating your face with a tasty surprise.
A\u00e7\u0131k\u00e7as\u0131 bu sizin us: Obviously this is subject to you being a decent baker.
\u0130yi kar\u0131\u015fmam\u0131\u015f: Poorly-fused lumps of flour, sugar and fat are more likely to make people pretend to be asleep when you knock.
Yiyecek \u00e7almak \u00f6\u011frenci yu: Stealing food is a common crime in student halls.
A\u00e7\u0131k\u00e7as\u0131 birisinin t: Obviously nicking someones chicken is theft, but is taking a drop of milk for your tea stealing?
Double check with the milk owner.
B\u00fcy\u00fck olas\u0131l\u0131kla i\u: Chances are they'll tell you to help yourself even if they're seething inside.
Birilerinin e\u015fyalar\u0131n\u0131 \u: If someone steals your stuff, it's annoying and you have my sympathies - but try to deal with it more maturely than my hallmate, who tainted her milk with washing-up liquid to punish those who stole it.
\u0130nsanlar\u0131 uyumaktan ya da ders: You shouldn't make noise that keeps people from sleeping or studying.
Bu sadece d\u00fczg\u00fcn bir insan olm: This isn't just to be a decent human, but because you are the proverbial people in glass houses.
Benim koridorumdaki bir k\u0131z yan tar: A girl on my corridor asked her neighbour if they wouldn't mind turning down the drum and bass because it was 3am and she had an exam in the morning.
Cevaplar\u0131 sesi daha da a\u00e7mak o: They responded by turning it up.
Sonunda sabah saat 5'te kapatt\u0131klar: When they finally shut up at 5am, she kindly let them sleep for two hours before blasting her own music, locking her door as she left for her three-hour exam.
Gelecekteki e\u015finin seninle ayn\u013: Wouldn't it be romantic if your future spouse happened to move into the same hall as you?
Tam tersi \u015fekilde, bir koridor arka: Conversely, wouldn't it be knuckle-bitingly awkward if you mistook a hallmate for your future spouse, hooked up, broke up and had to see them every day and possibly watch them get custody of all your mutual friends?
Tabii ki g\u00f6n\u00fcl bu fakat e\u011: Of course, the heart wants what it wants - but if a hot hallmate is definitely not your future spouse, try to at least talk some sense into your groin.
Ne\u015feli bir an\u0131n\u0131zda biris: In the exhilarating moment you realise someone's left their keys inside their unlocked room, the line between pranking and bullying is finer than it seems.
\u0130yi bir \u015faka e\u011flencelidir: A good prank is funny, but takes moments to reverse.
Birisine e\u015fyalar\u0131n\u0131 sakla: Teach a valuable and amusing lesson about security by hiding something - but never trash someone's room with toothpaste and shampoo.
Kap\u0131lar\u0131n\u0131 kilitle ve ana: Lock their door and put their keys in a glass of water, which you then put in the freezer - but don't Blu-Tack their possessions to the ceiling more than twice.
