Xi ekonomiyi d\u00fcnyaya daha \u00e7ok: Xi urges to open economy wider to world
Sal\u0131 g\u00fcn\u00fc, reformlar\u013: The economy must open wider to the outside world to fuel growth, President Xi Jinping told a group tasked with steering reform on Tuesday.
Genel Reformlar\u0131 G\u00fc\u00e7lendi: "China should be committed to attracting foreign investment and expertise, and improve opening-up policies," he said, addressing the 16th Meeting of the Central Leading Group for Deepening Overall Reform.
Xi, a\u00e7\u0131lmay\u0131 te\u015fvik: Promoting opening up while pushing forward reforms will add new impetus and vitality, and provide new room for economic growth, Xi said.
Lider grup, pazar eri\u015fimini d\u00fc: The leading group adopted a series of guidelines including a negative list regulating market access, relaxation of border-control policies, encouraging state-owned enterprises (SOE) to absorb private capital and overhauling the resident registration system.
A\u00e7\u0131klamaya g\u00f6re yat\u0131: According to the statement, a negative list, identifying sectors and businesses that are off-limits for investment, will be drawn up.
Sistem a\u015fama a\u015fama test edilec: The system will be gradually tested and improved through trial programs.
Bu \u00f6nemli bir hamle, zira piyasaya: The move is significant as it will give the market a bigger role in allocating resources, ensuring a law-based business environment and making the market more open, the statement said.
H\u00fck\u00fcmet ayn\u0131 zamanda \u01: The government will also loosen controls on the powers it delegates to companies, making sure that companies decide how to run their businesses.
Bu a\u00e7\u0131klamada ayn\u0131 zamand: The statement also said China will allow border areas to explore new models of cross-border economic cooperation and new mechanisms for promoting regional growth.
Devlet taraf\u0131ndan kontrol edilen se: In a bid to open up state-controlled sectors, more areas will be open to private investment.
A\u00e7\u0131klama, \"h\u00fck\u00fcmet: "The government will not change its policy toward foreign investment, and will protect the lawful interests of foreign-funded companies and provide better services for them," said the statement.
Buna ek olarak yabanc\u0131lar\u0131n s\: In addition, it will be made easier for foreigners to apply for permanent residence permits, or "green card," by optimizing requirements and streamlining the application process.
Hukuk\u00e7ular\u0131n pratik yapma hakl: Guaranteeing lawyers' right to practice and nurturing professional judges and prosecutors were also discussed at a meeting.
Toplant\u0131 sonras\u0131nda yay\u0131n: The meeting was also attended by Premier Li Keqiang, and senior leaders Liu Yunshan and Zhang Gaoli, according to a statement released after the meeting.
Minyat\u00fcr \u00e7anta \u015fimdi \u00: Mini-bags are the height of fashion - Zaman Newspaper Saturday Supplement
Moda d\u00fcnyas\u0131nda yollar d\u00f6: The subject eventually returned to bags in the world of fashion.
Son zamanlarda \u00f6ne \u00e7\u0131kan: The recent outstanding trend is those miniatures...
B\u00fcy\u00fcklerin yan\u0131na ili\u01: It is possible to say that the small bags that are placed next to the big ones draw attention.
Her \u015feyin k\u00fc\u00e7\u00fck olan: It is said that small is beautiful.
Bu bak\u0131\u015f a\u00e7\u0131s\u0131: This point of view also applies to bags.
Neredeyse valiz ebatlar\u0131nda \u00e7a: Even though we didn't tire of walking the streets with almost-suitcase-sized bags, the tide has started to turn and bags are inclined to be smaller.
K\u00fc\u00e7\u00fck \u00e7antalar zaten: Small bags already existed but they appeared before us in minimised versions of big shoulder bags.
Bu minicik \u00e7antalara ancak telefonu: Only your telephone, credit card and keys fit inside these tiny bags.
C\u00e9line and Herm\u00e8s ile ba\u015f: Starting with Céline and Hermès, the trend spread with Prada.
\u00c7anta hayranl\u0131\u011f\u0131n\u0: Transforming this bag mania into an interest for mini-bags has affected the newly emerging models.
Loewe, bu sezon haz\u0131rlad\u0131\u011: Loewe presented the fun bags it created in two sizes.
Panda, kutup ay\u0131s\u0131 ve fil bi\u: Among the bags, in the shape of pandas, polar bears and elephants, the most outstanding ones are the elephant-shaped ones.
L\u00fcks markalar\u0131n fenomen isimle: Presented by luxury brands with phenomenal names, mini versions of the big bags seem to attract red-carpet celebrities most.
Hermes'in, Jane Birkin'e ithafen haz\u01: One of the most popular is the "Birkin" bag Hermès created as a dedication to Jane Birkin.
Ger\u00e7i Jane Birkin, bas\u0131n a\u00: Even though Jane Birkin said that she does not want her name to be remembered with a bag, she is now imprinted in the memory in this way.
Moda haftalar\u0131 ise mini \u00e7anta: Fashion weeks led to the popularization of the mini-bag trend.
Podyumlarda da mini \u00e7antalar \u00f6: Consequently, mini-bags have been prominent on the podium.
Olduk\u00e7a minik olduklar\u0131 i\u00e: Since they are very small, it is not really possible to wear them on your arm.
Uzun ask\u0131lar\u0131yla \u00e7apraz h: They can be worn across the body with their long straps.
Ama podyumlarda o uzun ask\u0131lar\u013: However, we saw these straps tangled around the wrists of the models on the podium.
Fendi ise mini \u00e7anta mevzusunu iler: Fendi is one of those taking the mini-bag theme one step forward.
Mini \u00e7antaya s\u0131\u011famayan am: It has some advice for those who cannot fit into mini-bags but cannot abandon them either.
B\u00fcy\u00fck \u00e7antalara arkada\u0: Mini-bags as a friend of big bags.
Mini \u00e7antalar\u0131 b\u00fcy\u00fck: By transforming the mini-bags into a bag ornament that can be attached to bigger ones.
Podyumlarda \u00f6ne \u00e7\u0131kan bu: Featured on the podiums, this presentation has taken to the streets very quickly.
Bakal\u0131m daha neler g\u00f6rece\u011: Let's see what else we will see!
T\u00fcrkiye, denim konusunda d\u00fcnya: Turkey is on a level that can compete with world brands in terms of denim.
\u00dcretimde kazand\u0131\u011f\u0131 b: The experience gained in production has been enriched with design.
Eskiden birka\u00e7 tane olan siyah mode: We now see that black designs, having been few in the past, take their place on the shelves every season.
Siyahlar\u0131n bu kadar y\u00fckseli\u0: Denim found its closest friend in a season when black colours are on the rise.
Deri par\u00e7alar ve deri detayl\u0131: Leather pieces and designs with leather details come to the forefront as the rebellious friend of denim.
Genel olarak \"motorbike\" denen fermuar: Generally, zippered short designs called "motorbike" are most prominent .
Derinin g\u00fc\u00e7l\u00fc havas\u0131: The strong mood of leather complete with black pieces; chiffon long blouses and bright sweatshirts, provides a casual and chic appearance.
Eskiden gen\u00e7ler denim giyer ve kala: In the past, young people wore denim and wanted to be lost in the crowd.
G\u00fcn\u00fc kurtar\u0131r diye d\u00f: It was thought that it would save the day.
Art\u0131k gen\u00e7ler rahat oldu\u011f: Nowadays, young people want to wear designs that are comfortable and emphasise their style at the same time.
Bu a\u00e7\u0131dan Loft'un haz\u0131rla: Within this perspective, it can be said that Loft correctly understood its target group with their collections and accessories it designed
Banksy i\u00e7in k\u00fc\u00e7\u00fck, \: A small step for Banksy, a giant step for the "Global"
Gizemli sokak sanat\u00e7\u0131s\u0131 B: Bringing together the works of mysterious street artist Banksy, the world première of the collection "The Art of Banksy" was held in Istanbul.
Sanat\u00e7\u0131n\u0131n, 15 y\u0131ll\: A product of 15 years of work from the artist and gathering the originals of 85 works for the first time, the exhibition is the first in the Global Karaköy building .
Gizemli sokak sanat\u00e7\u0131s\u0131 B: The first exhibition by the mysterious street artist Banksy in Istanbul opened yesterday in the Global Karaköy (Rıhtım Street).
Kimli\u011fini gizleyen ve m\u00fcstear: The world famous artist, who conceals his identity and uses an alias, was not present at the exhibition opening of course.
\u0130stanbul'a gelip gelmedi\u011fini d: We also don't know if he came to Istanbul or not.
Fakat serginin k\u00fcrat\u00f6r\u00fc S: However, Banksy is not aware of this exhibition according to Steve Lazaridas, curator of the exhibition.
Ondan izin al\u0131nmas\u0131n\u0131 ger: It is not necessary to receive permission from him.
\u00c7\u00fcnk\u00fc eski arkada\u015f o: The reason is that old friends Banksy and Lazaridas parted company with each other after 12 years.
Sergilenen eserlerin bir k\u0131sm\u0131: The exhibited works were partly collected from Lazaridas and collectors.
Fakat Bansky takip\u00e7ilerinin merak e: However, there are issues that Banksy fans are curious about.
Banksy, 85 eserinin bir araya getirildi\: What would Banksy think about the exhibition "The Art of Banksy" which brings together 85 of his works?
Mesela sergiye biletle girilmesini (35 T: For example, what would he think of entering the exhibition with a ticket (35 TL)? What would he say if he saw the 800 square metre gallery space with a small store created at the end?
K\u0131rm\u0131z\u0131 Balonlu K\u0131z,: Would he raise his voice against the fact that cloth bags, wallets and necklaces are printed with works of his such as Red Balloon Girl, Maid, Smile Now, which draws attention to the wounds of the world?
Kimli\u011fini gizleyen, anar\u015fist r: Banksy followers feel disappointed by the turning of an exhibition of an artist who conceals his identity and has an anarchist soul into such consumer goods.
Hi\u00e7 Banksy'nin tarz\u0131 de\u011fi: This is certainly not the style of Banksy.
Ama siz yine de s\u0131n\u0131rl\u0131 s: Nevertheless, get your limited availability tickets before they are sold out!
Banksy i\u00e7in k\u00fc\u00e7\u00fck, g: Small for Banksy but giant for the globalised world, the exhibition "The Art of Banksy" can be seen until April.
Cumhurba\u015fkan\u0131 Recep Tayyip Erd: President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan continued his reaction against the academics that signed the declaration.
Erdo\u011fan, \"Bunlar zalimdir, bunlar: Erdoğan said, "They are cruel, they are despicable."
\u00c7\u00fcnk\u00fc, zalimlerle beraber: Because those who stand by the oppressors are oppressors.
\"Katliam yapanlarla birlikte olduklar\u: He said, "Since they stand by those who slaughtered, they committed the same offence".
Sultanahmet'teki patlama yerine karanfil: Laying flowers at the scene of the explosion in Sultanahmet, Recep Tayyip Erdoğan said, "I shared our grief both with the German President and German Chancellor because of the fact that 10 of our German friends were killed during this action in Sultanahmet Square that is full of history and civilization, and simply a square of peace - particularly in a place like this, near to the German Fountain."
T\u00fcm Alman halk\u0131na da ba\u015fs: Firstly I would like to convey my condolences to the German people, especially to the families of the victims.
\"Bizim ter\u00f6rle m\u00fccadelemiz ka: He said, "Our fight against terrorism will continue with determination".
Bildiri imzalayan akademisyenlere tepkis: Continuing his reaction towards the academics who signed the declaration, Erdoğan stated the following: "I condemn again and strongly condemn in particular the academics who put their signature under this slaughter by publishing a "pitch-black" declaration even in the face of all these terrorist incidents."
Milletimizin kimin kim oldu\u011funu \u0: I want our nation to understand much more closely who is who; in other words, having a title of professor, assistant professor does not make a person literate.
Bunlar zalimdir, bunlar al\u00e7akt\u013: They are cruel, they are despicable.
Katliam yapanlarla birlikte olduklar\u01: Since they stand by those who slaughtered, they also committed the same offence.
\u0130\u015fte \u00c7\u0131nar'da olan h: What do these dark academics think about those babies, 3-year old Mevlüde who died a martyr with her father in the incident that occurred in Çınar?
Onun katillerinin yan\u0131nda yer almay: How can they allow their conscience to stand by her killers?
B\u00fct\u00fcn yarg\u0131 makamlar\u013: I am inviting all the judicial authorities, university senates to do their duty for these acts against our constitution and laws.
D\u00fcn, at\u0131lmas\u0131 gereken ad\: Yesterday, I said that all the necessary steps should be taken rapidly.

Siyaset yapmak isteyenler parlamentoda s: If they want to do politics, let them do politics in parliament.
Ama parlamentoda yapam\u0131yorlarsa onl: If they cannot do it in parliament, let them go and dig ditches or go to the mountains.
Bu kadar a\u00e7\u0131k ve net konu\u015: I am saying it clearly and explicitly.
Milli E\u011fitim Bakanl\u0131\u011f\u01: The examination results were announced for the transition system from Primary Education to Secondary Education (TEOG), which is organized by the National Education Ministry for 8th grade students.
25-26 Kas\u0131m tarihlerinde yap\u0131l: The results of the exams, which were done on the dates of November 25-26, were finally announced.
A\u011f\u0131rl\u0131kland\u0131r\u0131l: Weighted Joint Exam Mark: Within the scope of joint exams, the marks obtained from the subjects examined are multiplied by their weight coefficient.
\u00c7arp\u0131mlar\u0131n toplam\u0131n: The figure obtained from the total of the multiplications, is divided by the total of the weight coefficients, and the periodically weighted joint exam mark is obtained for every term.
D\u00f6nemsel a\u011f\u0131rl\u0131kland: The maths average of the periodically weighted joint exam marks constitutes the weighted joint exam mark.
Puanlama 700 tam puan \u00fczerinden yap: Marking is done with a maximum of 700 points.
Yerle\u015ftirmeye esas puan: 6, 7 ve 8': Base mark decides placing: the success of the marks at the end of the 6th, 7th and 8th grades, and the weighted joint exam mark from 8th grade are totalled.
Elde edilen toplam ikiye b\u00f6l\u00fcn: The final total obtained is divided by two and the base mark for placing is obtained.
Puanlama 500 tam puan \u00fczerinden yap: Marking is done with a maximum of 500 points.

Gazi \u00dcniversitesi \u0130leti\u015fi: "We do not want ...... who supports PKK in our university", was written on papers which were hung on the office doors of some faculty members in the Faculty of Communication at Gazi University.
Ka\u011f\u0131d\u0131n alt\u0131na ise \: The caption "Gazi Communication"... was added to the lower part of the papers.
'Bar\u0131\u015f \u0130\u00e7in Akademis: There were many statements of response coming in particular from President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan and government officials to the 1128 academicians, who signed the declaration of the group named "The Initiative of Academics for Peace" under the title "We won't be a party to this crime".
Att\u0131klar\u0131 imza nedeniyle soru\: Subject to investigations because of the signatures they put, the academics started to be taken into custody and dismissed from their posts.

Japonya'n\u0131n Nagano eyaletindeki da\: At least 14 people died and 27 people were injured in the tour bus that careered off the road in a mountainous area of Nagano, Japan.
Emniyet yetkilileri, kayak yapmaya giden: Police Department officials stated that the tour bus, on which young people between 10 and 20 years old were going skiing, had the accident near the famous holiday town of Karuizawa.
Otob\u00fcs\u00fcn 3 metrelik kayan\u013: It was noted that the bus flew down a 3-metre high drop and overturned onto its side.
Otob\u00fcste toplam 41 ki\u015finin old: It was stated that there were 41 people in total on-board, and the casualties were brought to the hospital.

Kanada as\u0131ll\u0131 \u015fark\u0131c: René Angélil, the husband of Canadian singer Celine Dion, has passed away.
Ang\u00e9lil, 12 ya\u015f\u0131nda iken: Angélil discovered the talent of Dion when she was 12 years old, and the couple got married in 1994 in Montreal.
Ang\u00e9lil'e 1999'da kanser te\u015fhi: After Angélil was diagnosed with cancer in 1999, Celine Dion took a break from her career.
'\u0130ki g\u00fcre\u015f\u00e7i \u00e7o: "While I was searching for two wrestler children, I found 26 people"
Mete G\u00fcm\u00fcrhan'\u0131n ikinci b: The second documentary from Mete Gümürhan, "Young Wrestler", 66th.
Berlin Film Festivali'nin (11-21 \u015eu: It became the first Turkish documentary to be selected in the "Generation Kplus" section of the Berlin Film Festival (February 11-21).
Aslen Edirneli olan ama Hollanda'da yap\: Originally from Edirne but with a production company in the Netherlands, Gümürhan talked about how and why he shot the documentary which he completed in the summer of 2014.
G\u00fcre\u015f dal\u0131nda d\u00fcnya: Telling the story of six students in a boarding school from Amasya who aimed at becoming the world champion in the field of wrestling, the documentary "Young Wrestlers" will compete in the "Generation Kplus" section of the Berlin Film Festival.
Bu b\u00f6l\u00fcme se\u00e7ilen T\u00fc: Being the first made-in-Turkey documentary to be selected in this section, Young Wrestlers is one of the candidates for the Crystal Bear award.
Do\u011fma b\u00fcy\u00fcme Hollandal\u0: Mete Gümürhan is originally from Edirne even though he was born and raised in the Netherlands.
\u00c7ocukken yaz tatillerinde geldi\u01: He listened to stories about grease wrestling from his grandfather and watched competitions in Turkey, where he came during the summer when he was a child.
\"T\u00fcrkiye'de sadece politik sorunla: "There are not only political problems in Turkey."
Anadolu'da daha ba\u015fka neler ya\u015: I wanted to tell the world what is going on in Anatolia other than that.
\"\u00d6rne\u011fin, ata sporlar\u0131m\: With the idea, "wrestling, one of our ancestor sports, is not well known", for example, he brought together 6 directors and wanted to create a documentary project.
Bu proje sonu\u00e7suz kal\u0131r, ancak: This project remained inconclusive but news in a magazine he read on a plane opened the door to another project for Gümürhan.
10-11 ya\u015f\u0131ndaki g\u00fcre\u015: Tracing the article that talked about two little wrestler brothers aged 10-11, Mete Gümürhan went so Samsun, where their family lives.
\u00c7ocuklar\u0131n babas\u0131 belgese: The father of the children did not give permission to shoot a documentary.
G\u00fcm\u00fcrhan bu zorlu\u011fu nas\u: Gümürhan talked about how he overcame this challenge as follows: "I thought about what I could do all day long."
\u00c7\u00fcnk\u00fc K\u00fclt\u00fcr Ba: "Because the support of the Ministry of Culture might be withdrawn."
Baba g\u00f6r\u00fc\u015fmede \u00e7ocuk: The father mentioned a boarding school in Amasya, where the children would go.
Ben iki \u00e7ocuk ararken okulda g\u00f: While I was searching for two children, I found 26 children with an interest in wrestling.
Bir haftada \u00e7ekim haz\u0131rl\u0131: We started shooting preparations and finalized the authorization.
We did not even have a place to stay.
\"\u015eeker fabrikas\u0131n\u0131n yata: "We stayed in the dormitory of a sugar factory."
\u00c7ekimleri 3 haftada tamamlanan belg: Language was the biggest challenge posed for the director by the documentary, the shooting of which was completed in 3 weeks.
Yabanc\u0131 g\u00f6r\u00fcnt\u00fc y\u0: Stating that three different languages were spoken on the set of the film in which a foreign director of cinematography and a soundman worked, Gümürhan said, "I did not know what I would come across during the shoot."
\"Onlar da T\u00fcrk\u00e7e bilmiyordu\": He says, "They did not know Turkish either".
Gen\u00e7 Pehlivanlar, 26 \u00e7ocuk g\u: Young wrestlers focuses on the story of six of the 26 child wrestlers.
Dedesi taraf\u0131ndan b\u00fcy\u00fct\u: Baran, who was brought up by his grandfather and had a weight problem, Harun, who could not participate in training because he broke his arm, Beytullah, who is ambitious but has some health problems, Ümit, who is the pretty boy of the school, the youngest champion Ahmet and Muhammed, who holds the group together...
Mete G\u00fcm\u00fcrhan, \u00e7ocuklarla: Mete Gümürhan says of working with the children as follows: "I let them be completely natural."
Sadece Muhammed'i her yerde kullanmaya \: I tried to use only Muhammed everywhere.
\u0130lk bir bu\u00e7uk hafta antrenmanl: I shot the training for the first one and a half weeks.
\u0130ste\u011fim \u00e7ocuklar\u0131n k: I wanted that the children act as if there were no camera.
Berlin'e se\u00e7ilmek s\u00fcrpriz oldu: It was a surprise to be selected for Berlin
Gen\u00e7 Pehlivanlar'\u0131n Berlin Fil: Stating that he did not expect Young Wrestlers to be selected for the Berlin Film Festival, Mete Gümürhan said, "We were ready, but it was a surprise for us to be selected for Berlin".
Gen\u00e7 Pehlivanlar bir spor belgeseli: Young Wrestlers is not a sports documentary, it is a production that narrates the struggle of the children and a slice of their life.
\"Ailevi sorunlar\u0131 olan \u00e7ocukl: He says, "I wanted to highlight the struggle of children with family problems to find an identity and their story of coping with their problems".
Sanat d\u00fcnyas\u0131ndan akademisyenl: Support from the world of art for the academics
\"Bar\u0131\u015f \u0130\u00e7in Akademi: The storm that broke out after the declaration of "The Initiative of Academics for Peace", went so far that investigations were opened against the academics and they were taken into custody yesterday; but at the same time, there are also statements of support arriving one after another.
\u0130lk destek, aralar\u0131nda \u00e7o: The first support came from the literati, among whom there are many famous people.
\u00d6nceki g\u00fcn sinemac\u0131lar, d: Film makers expressed their support the day before yesterday, and theatre actors did so yesterday.
138 tiyatrocunun imzas\u0131yla yap\u013: In the explanation made with the signatures of 138 theatre actors, it was stated, "We, as artists working in the field of theatre and stage-performance, stand by this honourable meeting of academics making a call for peace; and we state that we stand by the freedom of expression, equality, right to life and unconditional peace".
\"Vicdan\u0131m\u0131z ve t\u00fcm kalbi: It was said, "We add our voice to the discussion and peace calls from the academics with all our heart and conscience".
Aralar\u0131nda Deniz T\u00fcrkali, Atil: More than 400 film makers including Deniz Türkali, Atilla Özdemiroğlu, Nadir Sarıbacak, Özcan Alper, Serra Yılmaz, Onur Ünlü, Yeşim Ustaoğlu, Pelin Esmer, Tolga Karaçelik stated that, "We stand by free thought and art".
Ama's\u0131z fakat's\u0131z e\u011fer'si: Without using but, however and if: "We won't take part in this crime!"
Bar\u0131\u015f \u0130\u00e7in Akademisy: They supported the academics by saying, "We stand by the Initiative of the Academics for Peace".
Sinema Yazarlar\u0131 Derne\u011fi (S\u0: The Screenwriters Association (SİYAD) also made a statement and said, "We stand by the academics, who were made the target of a lynching campaign".
Bar\u0131\u015f \u0130\u00e7in Akademisy: The Initiative of Academics for Peace called for peace and discussion from the government with simultaneous statements in Ankara and Istanbul on January 11; and it published a declaration under the title, "We are not party to this crime".
Metne 89 \u00fcniversitedeki 1128 akadem: In addition to the 1128 academics from 89 universities, the text was signed by thinkers such as Noam Chomsky, David Harvey, Immanuel Wallerstein, Judith Butler, and Etienne Balibar, who have worldwide fame through their theories and books.
Cumhurba\u015fkan\u0131 Erdo\u011fan ve: President Erdoğan and Prime Minister Davutoğlu defined the declaration of the academics as "support for terrorism" and criticised it very harshly; and Erdoğan called on organizations to "do what is needed".
Bu \u00e7a\u011fr\u0131 sonras\u0131nda: After this call, some universities fired the academics and the prosecution office brought an ex-officio prosecution.
D\u00fcn ise \u00e7ok say\u0131da akadem: Many academics were taken into custody yesterday.
Hayran\u0131n\u0131z\u0131m, l\u00fctfen: I am your fan, please help me!
H\u00fcrrem Sultan'\u0131n k\u0131z\u013: Hürrem Sultan's red hair, Beren's nose, Justin's hair...
\u00dcnl\u00fclere benzemeye \u00e7al\u0: Trying to look like celebrities is considered normal to some extent but it is regarded as a psychological disorder after the point that it starts to completely affect your life.
'Celebrity worship syndrome', nam-\u0131: "Celebrity worship syndrome", also known as "the syndrome of worshipping famous people" is a matter that has already become an academic issue around the world and is a newly spoken about issue in our country.
Kuaf\u00f6r salonlar\u0131na han\u0131me: It can be considered normal to some extent that ladies run to the hair salons with photos of celebrities.
Ama b\u00fct\u00fcn ergenlerin \u0130rla: However, we should not forget the "Hürrem Sultan" year when all the youth walked around with red Irish hair.
Geride b\u0131rakt\u0131\u011f\u0131m\u0: It was already reported that "Beren's nose" led the way in plastic surgeries in 2015.
Beyler cephesinde de durum pek farkl\u01: The situation is not so very different on the part of men.
Bir d\u00f6nem Polat Alemdar gibi giyinm: Once upon a time, dressing like Polat Alemdar was a custom.
\u015eimdi ise tam tersi bir r\u00fczgar: Now a totally different trend prevails everywhere.
Justin Bieber kopyas\u0131 delikanl\u013: Our surroundings are full of young boys that are copies of Justin Bieber.
O kadar ki al\u0131nt\u0131lad\u0131\u01: It is at such an extent that the following quote of useless information was read thousands of times: "Firstly, when you go to the hairdresser, have your hair cut at the sides, in other words, the part over and around your ears up to the upper part of your head."
However, the sides should be short.
Kesim i\u015flemi bittikten sonra sa\u00: After the cutting process is over, you should shape your hair lightly with water.
\u015eekil verme i\u015flemi bittikten s: After the shaping process, fix your hair with the help of spray.
\"Justin sa\u00e7\u0131 elde etmek i\u00: "It is necessary to shape it when it is wet to get Justin hair."
B\u00fct\u00fcn bunlar, d\u00fcnyada \u0: All of these issues have already become academic subjects around the world, but they remind us of the newly spoken "celebrity worship syndrome", in other words "the syndrome of worshipping famous people".
\u00dcnl\u00fclerin fanlar\u0131 bizde s: Fans of celebrities are considered as a "bundle of love".
Sanat\u00e7\u0131lar hayran say\u0131lar: Artists always pride themselves on their fan numbers and how their fans affect them.
Neyse ki psikoloji durumu o kadar basit: Luckily, psychology does not consider the condition so simply.
Bilhassa ergenlerin ne yiyip i\u00e7ece\: In particular, it is much discussed that adolescents make decisions about what they eat and drink, what they listen to, what they wear in accordance with celebrities.
Ula\u015f\u0131lmaz olarak sunulan isiml: Excessive loyalty to people presented as unattainable, and taking them as role models is defined as a mental disorder.
Uzman psikolog S\u00fcmeyye Demir, T\u00: Senior psychologist Sümeyye Demir accepts that Turkey falls behind in terms of studies into this field.
Ancak ailelerin yava\u015f yava\u015f bi: However she does not fail to notice the fact that families are gradually becoming conscious: "One of the basic issues in the science of psychology is people being at peace with themselves and finding peace in their identities".
\u00d6nceleri \u00e7ocuklar\u0131n odas\: In the past, it was not taken seriously if children filled their rooms with posters and played the role of someone.
Ebeveyni duruma m\u00fcdahale etme ihtiy: Their parents feel the need to intervene in the situation.
\"Birine tutkuyla ba\u011fl\u0131l\u0131: "Passionate loyalty to someone is a sign of the fact that something has gone wrong in the teen's life."
Duygusal h\u0131z trenine binen hayranla: Fans jumping onto the emotional speed train
\u00dcnl\u00fclere ilgi, a\u015f\u0131r\: Interest in celebrity is safe in moderation.
Evlenmesini istememek, e\u015finden k\u0: Demir advises to be careful of symptoms such as not wanting them to marry, envying their spouses and preferring their clothing styles.
Ad\u0131 \u00fcst\u00fcnde \u015f\u00f6h: As the name implies, we are talking about famous people.
Onlar\u0131 merak etmek, hayatlar\u0131y: Being curious about them and having an interest in their life is considered normal to some extent.
Fakat uzman psikolo\u011fun kanaatince k: However, young people overstepping the limits are prevalent according to the senior psychologist: "When there is no one in the family or the surroundings to serve as a model for virtues and good behaviour, this gap is certainly filled."
Her zaman iyi \u00f6rnekler \u00e7\u0131: Good examples do not always emerge.
Onlara nas\u0131l yakla\u015faca\u011f\u: When we consult her about how we should approach them, Sümeyye Demir starts by reminding us that the syndrome of celebrity worship is seen mostly in adolescence.
Ergenlerin \u00f6z g\u00fcvensiz olabile: The problem is more easily overcome once it is taken into consideration that adolescents may be insecure.
Bir yandan ailelerinin s\u0131n\u0131rla: On one hand, we are complaining about the limitations of family and on the other hand we are facing young people expecting support and affection from them: "We are obliged to take into consideration their emotional ups and downs."
Yeni ara\u015ft\u0131rmalar beyinlerinde: New research put forward that they are forced by the changes occurring in their brains.
\"Duygusal h\u0131z trenine binen gencin: "It should be taken naturally if an adolescent, jumping onto the emotional speed train, is attached to someone; and they should be approached delicately."
Davran\u0131\u015flar\u0131 de\u011fi\u0: It is possible to change behaviour
Uzman psikolog S\u00fcmeyye Demir, \u015: Senior psychologist Sümeyye Demir, reminds us of the duties falling into the share of parents to overcome celebrity worship syndrome:
Onun duygusal s\u0131k\u0131nt\u0131s\u0: Identify their emotional problem and be sure that you are calm before bringing up the issue.
Asla duygular\u0131n\u0131 bast\u0131rma: Never let them suppress their emotions.
Ba\u011f\u0131ms\u0131zl\u0131\u011f\u01: Express your respect for their adoration in order to encourage freedom.
Azarlayarak \u00f6\u011fretmek yerine iy: Instead of teaching them by reprimanding, serve as a good model for them, discuss the people that can be a role model to them.
\u00dcnl\u00fclerin g\u00fcndelik hayat\: Try to talk together about the roles of celebrities in our daily life.
\u015e\u00f6hretlilerin ger\u00e7ek d\u0: It would be helpful to read books about the real world of celebrities together.
\u0130leti\u015fiminizi muhakkak yeti\u0: Change your communication approach to the form of adult to adult.
Ba\u011f\u0131ml\u0131l\u0131k ve motiva: Do not forget the fact that addiction and motivation use the brain in the same way.
Hatalar\u0131n de\u011fi\u015fim i\u00e7: Tell your child that errors are opportunities for change, and accept them as they are.
Fanl\u0131k konusunda mutlaka uzman dest: Get the support of specialists dealing with being a fan.
Sinirlenen de g\u0131pta eden de hayranl: Those who get angry and those who admire both worship
\u015e\u00f6hretliye tap\u0131nma sendro: At the base of the syndrome of celebrity worship there is a need to appeal and get help from someone.
Engellenemeyen sevgi, bir yard\u0131m \u: It is in fact a unpreventable love, a call for help.
Ama ne yaz\u0131k ki b\u00f6yle alg\u013: But unfortunately it is not perceived like this.
\u00dcstelik bu sorun o kadar yayg\u0131: Furthermore, this problem is so widespread that it is not possible to narrow it down to a country or a continent.
Dr. Recai Yahyao\u011flu, her \u00fclked: Dr. Recai Yahyaoğlu draws attention to the fact that there are certain people that occupy the television in every country.
Sendrom daha \u00e7ok bu \u00fcnl\u00fcl: The syndrome manifests itself mostly in an attachment to the celebrities: "They are extraordinary."
Genel \u00e7o\u011funluk onlar\u0131n im: Most people do not have their opportunities.
Sahip olanlar ise onlar gibi davranarak: Those who have do not live their life by acting like them.
Ya benimsemediklerinden ya da cesaret ed: It is because they do not embrace this life or they do not dare to do it.
\"Fakat gerek imk\u00e2n\u0131 olmayanla: "However, both those who do not have the opportunities, and those who have the opportunities but do not live like them continue to watch them angrily."
G\u0131pta eden ya da sinirden k\u00f6p\: There is no difference between those who covet them and those who watch them bursting with anger.
Onlar zahmetsiz para kazan\u0131r, onlar: They earn money without trouble, they are in magazines daily.
Bunu bilmek bile yetiyor fanl\u0131\u011: Even knowing this is enough to increase their admiration.
Uzman Psikolog S\u00fcmeyye Demir'in bir: Other advice from the senior psychologist Sümeyye Demir is to question the reality of these lives.
Suni hayatlar\u0131n s\u00f6z konusu old: We should not fail to notice that artificial lives are being talked about.
\u015e\u00f6hretliye tutku duyan ki\u015: Support from the surrounding people steps in for the person who feels passionately about celebrity.
Ancak ki\u015fi fan\u0131 oldu\u011fu \u: However, people insist on rejecting the fact that the celebrities they admire also have problems like them.

Safra kesesi ameliyat\u0131 olmal\u0131: Should I undergo a cholecystostomy? - Family-Health News - Zaman Newspaper
Dr. Fevzi \u00d6zg\u00f6n\u00fcl, Meydan: Dr. Fevzi Özgönül answers the questions in his column in the Meydan Newspaper..
Benim safra kesemde ta\u015f var ve her: I have gallstones, I have stomach ache when I get up every morning and after meals; and I visit the toilet 2 times or more everyday.
Bu da benim kilo vermemi engelliyor olab: Could it prevent me from losing weight?
\u015eu anda alkalen kullanmaya ba\u015f: I have now started to use alkaline, but my appetite for meals hasn't diminished, I cannot lose any weight.
It has been the same since my childhood.
Sizce safra kesesi ameliyat\u0131 olmal\: In your opinion, should I undergo a cholecystostomy?
CEVAP: Safra kesesi ta\u015f\u0131na \u0: ANSWER: Most of the time, an infection accompanies gallstones.
Yemekten hemen sonra geli\u015fen bu kar: This complaint of stomach aches, occurring soon after meals, is a sign of the fact that your gallbladder tightens when you eat and you spill the infected gall into the intestines.
\u0130ltihapl\u0131 safra nedeniyle raha: Disturbed by the infected gall, the intestines try to quickly expel this gall.
\u0130\u015fte bu nedenle siz s\u0131k t: This is why you visit the toilet frequently.
S\u0131k tuvalete \u00e7\u0131kt\u0131\u: Since you visit the toilet frequently and what you eat is expelled without being digested, losing weight becomes slower.
Bence bu durumu tedavi ettirmeniz gereki: In my opinion, you should have this condition treated.
Gastro enterolog bir uzmana giderseniz v: If you go to a gastroenterologist and the condition is detected as I said, you can be free from this condition by using antibiotics.
Fakat eninde sonunda safra kesesi ameliy: However, you may eventually have to undergo a cholecystostomy.
Alkalen probiyotik bu \u015fik\u00e2yetl: Alkaline probiotics may decrease your symptons but it does not cure them.
Her ne olursa olsun alkalen probiyoti\u0: I advise you to use alkaline probiotics anyway.
\u00c7\u00fcnk\u00fc zay\u0131flaman\u01: Because this probiotic powder is the biggest help in losing weight.
Stresliyken \u00e7ok yemek yiyorum: I eat too much under stress
Hocam stresli ve sinirli oldu\u011fum za: Dear sir, I eat continuously when I am stressed and angry; and I gain weight.
Bununla nas\u0131l ba\u015f edebilirim?: How can I cope with this?
CEVAP: A\u015f\u0131r\u0131 yemek iste\u: ANSWER: An excessive appetite for food means in fact that your energy needs are not met.
Bunun nedeni az yemi\u015f olmak veya sa: The reason for this may be eating less or skipping morning meals and lunches.
Bir di\u011fer neden de yedi\u011finiz b: Another reason is your failure to digest the food you eat.
Bunun i\u00e7in sindirim sisteminizin sa: To do this, your digestive system should work healthily.
E\u011fer \u00fclser, refl\u00fc veya bu: If you do not have a problem such as an ulcer, reflux or similar problems, the easiest way is to use a good probiotic medicine.
Yarar\u0131n\u0131 fazlas\u0131yla g\u00: You will greatly feel its benefits.
Kilo alam\u0131yorum, doktorlar sebebini: I cannot gain weight, doctors do not know the reason
K\u00f6\u015fenizde genellikle zay\u0131: Generally there is information about losing weight in your column.
Bana da \u00e7ok mant\u0131kl\u0131 geli: All of it seems logical to me too, but my situation is a little bit different.
En \u00f6nemlisi bunun sebebini de bilmi: The most important thing is I do not know why.
Doctors do not say anything either.
CEVAP: Bizim uygulad\u0131\u011f\u0131m\: ANSWER: The techniques we apply are not intended for losing weight, but also regaining the physiological functions of the body and turning it into its ideal size.
\u015ei\u015fmanl\u0131kla zay\u0131fl\u: Being overweight and being too thin are the same kinds of disorder.
\u015ei\u015fmanl\u0131kta kilo verememe: Failure to lose weight when fat and failure to gain weight when slim are cured with the same technique.
Siz de tatl\u0131 ve hamur i\u015fi g\u0: You lose weight more when you eat sweets and pastries.
Zannederim bunu \u015fimdiye kadar anlam: I imagine you might have understood this by now.
Sizin de karboksipunktur ile uyar\u0131l: It is also possible for you to be stimulated with Carboxy therapy and gain weight through a healthy diet.
Yani siz ideal bedeninizden zay\u0131fla: In other words, you became distant from your ideal body by losing weight.
Di\u011fer hastalar\u0131m\u0131z da ide: Other patients of ours became distant from their ideal bodies by putting on weight.
Siz kilo alarak ideal bedeninize ula\u01: You will reach your ideal body by gaining weight, and they will do so by losing weight.
Sistem sorunu ortadan kalkarsa siz kilo: If the problem with the system is eliminated, you will gain weight, they will lose weight.
Fakat \u00f6ncelikle sistemin d\u00fczg\: Nevertheless, firstly the system should work properly.

Bur\u00e7in Terzio\u011flu, Esra Erol, D: People like Burçin Terzioğlu, Esra Erol, Demet Akalın, Buse Terim were awarded with "Women's Awards", which were given out for the second time.

Kendini de\u011fersiz hisseden \u00e7ocu: Children who feel worthless become stuck in "hatred"
\u0130nsan\u0131n his d\u00fcnyas\u0131n: There are some innate emotions in people's world of emotion.
Korku, \u00fcz\u00fcnt\u00fc, mutluluk,: Fear, sadness, happiness, astonishment, anger, anxiety...
Ancak nefret, kin, intikam gibi hisler \: However, some emotions like hatred, holding a grudge and revenge emerge in children gradually and as a result of the wrong behaviour.
Her insan \u00e7ocukluk d\u00f6nemi de d: Everybody needs to be an individual including during their childhood.
Yani ebeveyn ya da sosyal \u00e7evresi k: In other words, they desire that their parents and social circle respect their decisions, their opinion is asked in matters related to them, and they are made to feel valued.
Bunlar\u0131n sa\u011flanmas\u0131 sa\u0: Enabling them to create the base on which to construct a healthy personality.
\u00d6rne\u011fin \u00e7ocu\u011fu ilgil: For example, behaviour such as making decisions in matters relating to the child (what they wear, what they eat) instead of the child, insisting on your truth without considering the wishes of the child (sending a child to a music course even though they want to go to a football course) means not respecting the personality of the child.
Benli\u011fine ve varl\u0131\u011f\u0131: When their individuality and being are not respected, children lose the freedom of "being themselves" and their defence mechanism reveals emotions of anger and hatred in order to protect themselves.
\"\u00c7\u00fcnk\u00fc asl\u0131nda \u00: Stating that, "The reason is that anger and hatred are in fact just opposites of acceptance", psychologist Hilal Arslan says that children do not accept what is done to them by showing hate and they try to say to both themselves and the people around them that they are precious.
\u00c7ocu\u011fun durumu kabul etmeyip b: Saying that it is good for their personality development that children do not accept the situation and react to it, the senior psychologist said, "The hatred here means I am also here, it serves the children's aim to protect their self-respect".
\"\u00c7ocu\u011fun birey olmas\u0131na: She says, "If children are allowed to be individuals, the hatred will be eliminated".
\u00c7ocuk, \u00f6fke ve nefrete s\u0131: Children try to protect their self by resorting to anger and hatred
K\u00fc\u00e7\u00fck ya\u015fta, hem bed: Saying that if children are exposed to the verbal and emotional violence of their parents and surroundings, it will cause negative emotions in children in a time that they are at a young age and are both physically and spiritually most vulnerable, Arslan states that negligence will make the child feel that their existence is not noticed and they are invisible.
Arslan s\u00f6zlerine \u015f\u00f6yle de: Arslan continues with the following: "Maybe sometimes we can fail to meet the emotional needs (not stroking their hair, not hugging and kissing them, not caring about their school or other needs), and sometimes we can fail to meet also their physical needs (eating, drinking, shelter, school needs etc.)."
Bu \u00f6fkeye ne nefrete kap\u0131 a\u0: This is a growing attitude that opens the doors to anger and hatred.
Duygusal ve s\u00f6zel \u015fiddette ise: For emotional and verbal violence, there is behaviour like humiliation, insulting, belittling, scolding, unnecessary and heavy punishment, making them feel worthless and yelling.
Bu davran\u0131\u015flar \u00e7ocu\u011f: Since this behaviour is towards the personality of the child, it has a deep effect.
\"\u00c7ocuk ya bunlar\u0131 kabullenere: "Children who accept it, lose their self-respect and spend their lives struggling with the feeling that they are worthless, unworthy of being loved and inadequate, or they will protect themselves by resorting to anger and hatred."

\"Pe\u015fini b\u0131rakmayaca\u011f\u01: He said, "We won't stop chasing it".

En az 20 \u00f6l\u00fc, 15 yaral\u0131-D: At least 20 killed, 15 wounded - World News - Zaman Newspaper
Bat\u0131 Afrika \u00fclkesi Burkina Fas: In Ouagadougou, the capital of the West African Country Burkina Faso, at least 20 people were killed and 15 people injured in gun and bomb attacks at a hotel popular among foreigners, and the next door cafeteria.
Sald\u0131r\u0131y\u0131 El Kaide ba\u01: The Al Qaeda connected local group Maghrib claimed responsibility for the attack.

G\u00fcvenlik g\u00fc\u00e7lerinin sald\: Starting 5 hours after the attack, security forces operations are still continuing.
Kimsenin yakla\u015ft\u0131r\u0131lmad\u: The deafening noise of explosions and gunshot are heard coming from the building, which nobody is allowed to approach.
Patlay\u0131c\u0131lar sebebiyle otelde: Because of the explosions, a small fire still continues to burn in the hotel.
\u0130\u00e7eride ka\u00e7 ki\u015finin: It is not yet known how many people are held hostage inside.

Yalgado Ouedraogo Hastanesi y\u00f6netic: The director of the Yalgado Ouedraogo Hospital, Robert Sangare, noted that 20 people were killed during the siege and the 15 people with bullet wounds are in a serious condition; and they are concerned that the number of dead will increase.

Romanya se\u00e7im harcamalar\u0131nda \: Romania heads towards transparency in election expenses
Romanya'da se\u00e7im kullan\u0131lan pa: A new draft law was prepared in Romania to precisely determine the source of money used in elections and to place an upper limit on expenses.
H\u00fck\u00fcmet, se\u00e7imlerde siyas: The government wants that transactions of monetary assistance are more transparently done by individuals and companies to the politicians in the elections.

Bah\u00e7eli bug\u00fcn istirahat edecek: Bahçeli will take a rest today
Kocaeli'nin \u00c7ay\u0131rova \u0130l\u: Having undergone an angiography in a private hospital in the Çayırova district, Kocaeli, the General President of MHP, Devlet Bahçeli, was reported to be taking a rest today.
MHP Genel Ba\u015fkan\u0131 Devlet Bah\u: General President of MHP Devlet Bahçeli underwent an angiography yesterday at the Anadolu Health Centre in Çayırova.
Devlet Bah\u00e7eli'nin sa\u011fl\u0131k: A written statement was made by the hospital regarding the health conditions of Devlet Bahçeli.
Yap\u0131lan a\u00e7\u0131klamada, \"MHP: It was said in the statement that, "As stated in the explanation from the MHP Press Office, he was admitted to our hospital for a previously planned health check."
Kontroller dahilinde koroner anjiyografi: A coronary angiography was performed with the checks.
\"Sa\u011fl\u0131k durumu son derece iyi: It was stated that, "He is in very good health, and he is resting in the hospital today".
Devlet Bah\u00e7eli'yi ziyaret etmek i\u: Arriving at the hospital to visit Devlet Bahçeli, MHP Kocaeli deputy Saffet Sancaklı explained that, "As you know, our esteemed general president underwent a controlled angiography."
His health condition is very good.
Bug\u00fcn de hastanede istirahatine dev: He will continue his recovery in hospital also today.

Yar\u0131n da doktorlar tekrardan bakaca: Doctors will check it again tomorrow.
\"Biliyorsunuz bu durumlarda en \u00f6ne: He said, "You know that the most important thing in these situations is what the doctors say".
T\u00fcrkiye'de gazetecilere sald\u0131r: Attacks on journalists have become a normal part of life in Turkey
\u00d6n\u00fcm\u00fczdeki hafta Londra'y: 25 famous writers sent a letter regarding Turkey to U.K. Prime Minister Cameron with joint signatories before the visit of Davutoğlu who is preparing to go to London next week.
PEN \u00fcyesi yazarlar, Cameron'dan Dav: As members of PEN, the writers wanted Cameron to bring up the decline experienced in freedom of expression and the press in Turkey in his meeting with Davutoğlu.
\u0130ngiltere'nin \u00f6nde gelen yazar: Leading writers in the United Kingdom sent a letter to Prime Minister David Cameron asking him to bring up the decline experienced in freedom of expression and the press in Turkey during the London visit by his counterpart Ahmet Davutoğlu next week.
Uluslararas\u0131 Yazarlar Birli\u011fi': Including England, Wales and Scotland, Presidents of the Worldwide Association of Writers (PEN), the 25 writers expressed their serious concerns about "the unprecedented pressures towards freedom of expression in Turkey".
Gazeteci, yazar ve yay\u0131nc\u0131lara: Stating that threats and physical attacks against journalists, writers and publishers in Turkey have become a normal part of life, giving the examples of the attacks on the offices of the Hurriyet daily newspaper, the raid on the Koza İpek Media Group and seizure of it.
Aralar\u0131nda Tom Stoppard, Ali Smith,: In the letter from PEN member-writers including famous English writers such as Tom Stoppard, Ali Smith, Ian Rankin and Elif Şafak, it was underlined that 3 journalists working for the Vice News organization were detained, law suits were opened against other journalists and the detention of journalists continued.
M\u0130T TIR'lar\u0131 olay\u0131nda Can: Stating that the detention of Can Dündar and Erdem Gül in the investigation phase of the MİT's trucks case also caused concern, the writers expressed that, "It is vitally important that journalists in Turkey fulfil their fundamental duties to society and they have the permission to inform public opinion without any limitation and censorship".
Gazetecilere, yazarlara ve yay\u0131nc\u: They noted that the attacks toward journalists, writers and publishers wear away all the freedoms of Turkish society.
Yayg\u0131n \"dokunulmazl\u0131k k\u00fc: They stated that the journalists and writers are exposed to threatening methods including physical attacks because of the widespread "impunity culture".
Yazarlar, \"cumhurba\u015fkan\u0131na ha: The writers drew attention to the fact that there is an increasing number of Turkish citizens against whom lawsuits were brought with the accusation of "insulting the President", and Erdoğan brought more libel lawsuits than the total of his predecessors after he was elected in 2014.
Gelecek hafta Londra'y\u0131 ziyaret ede: It was underlined that Prime Minister Ahmet Davutoğlu, visiting London next week, is one of the cabinet members expressing his support for press freedom, but it was stated that these remarks were not followed through.
Mektupta, \"Bu nedenle Davuto\u011flu'nu: It was stated in the letter that, "For this reason, the London visit of Davutoğlu constitutes an important opportunity to clearly guarantee freedom of expression in Turkey".
Yazarlar Cameron'dan, Ba\u015fbakan Davu: The writers requested Cameron to call on Prime Minister Davutoğlu to ensure that his cabinet will be respectful of their responsibilities on the subject of freedom of expression in Turkey.
Mektupta imzalar\u0131 bulunan 25 yazar:: The 25 writers that signed the letter are as follows:
Monica Ali, Alan Bissett, William Boyd,: Monica Ali, Alan Bissett, William Boyd, Chris Brookmyre, Gillian Clarke, Drew Campbell (President of PEN Scotland), Fflur Dafydd, Stevie Davies, Menna Elfyn (President of PEN Wales), Moris Farhi, Maureen Freely (President of PEN U.K.), Richard Gwyn, Mark Haddon, David Hare, Eva Hoffman, Hari Kunzru, Robert Minhinnick, Blake Morrison, Neel Mukherjee, Ian Rankin, Elif Şafak, Owen Sheers, Ali Smith, Tom Stoppard, Sarah Waters.
Cizre'de \u00e7at\u0131\u015fmalar t\u00: Clashes in Cizre spread to surrounding neighbourhoods, 2 children were killed in the backyard of their home
\u015e\u0131rnak'\u0131n Cizre il\u00e7e: Declared as of December 14, the curfew continues in the Cizre district, Şırnak.
Yasa\u011f\u0131n ba\u015flad\u0131\u011: The noise of gunshots and explosions have not ceased since the first day of the ban.
Zaman zaman \u00e7ok \u015fiddetli \u00e: Residents are leaving the district, which has occasionally witnessed very violent clashes.
Da\u011fkap\u0131 mahallesinde bulunan b: An explosive hit a house in the Dağkapı neighbourhood; two children aged 11 and 12 were killed.
G\u00fcvenlik g\u00fc\u00e7leri ile PKK': Clashes occurring between security forces and the PKK left residents in a difficult situation.
Geride kalan 33 g\u00fcnde hendeklerin b: In the past 33 days, the residents of Nur, Cudi, Sur and Yafes neighbourhoods are leaving these areas which have trenches; and electricity and water have not been provided to these areas for 33 days.
Hendek ve barikatlar\u0131n bulunmad\u01: Residents of the neighbourhoods that do not have trenches and barricades also had to leave because of the clashes experienced there.
Kimi vatanda\u015f\u0131n arac\u0131na a: Some residents left the district with a white flag hung from their cars, and those who do not have cars moved to the surrounding district taking as many articles as they could with them.
\u00d6zellikle hendek ve barikatlar\u013: While clashes were continuing especially in the neighbourhoods that have trenches and barricades, the residents had moved to more central neighbourhoods.
Ancak son zamanlarda bu mahallelerde de: However, residents had to move from there because clashes recently occurred also in these neighbourhoods.
Bu mahallelerden Da\u011fkap\u0131 Mahal: In one of these neighbourhoods, in Dağkapı, first cousins 12 year-old Yusuf Akalın and 11 year-old Büşra Akalın were killed because they were hit by shrapnel after an explosion hit their door when they were in the backyard.
\u015eah Mahallesinde n\u00fcfus yo\u011: 3 people were injured because of an explosive thrown into a building in an area of the Şah neighbourhood where population density is high.
Yasa\u011f\u0131n bir ay\u0131 ge\u00e7m: The need for cash emerged for most residents because the ban has exceeded one month.
B\u00fct\u00fcn banka ve ATM'lerin kapal: The residents have to use their credit cards in a district in which all the banks and ATMs are closed.
Kredi kart\u0131 olmayan vatanda\u015fla: Those who do not have a credit card are in a difficult situation.
G\u0131da ve ila\u00e7 ihtiyac\u0131n\u0: Not being able to cover the costs of food and medicine, most of the residents left.
\u0130l\u00e7ede kalanlar ise akrabalar\: Those who remained in the district survive with the help of their relatives and benefactors in Cizre.
Sadece acil vakalar\u0131n hastaneye gid: No medical intervention can be made for those with toothache in the district in which only people with emergencies can go to hospital.
B\u00fcy\u00fck operasyonun ba\u015flad\: Education cannot be provided in the district where schools have been closed since December 14 when the major operation started.
16 ve 17 Ocak'ta yap\u0131lacak olan A\u: Students who had to enter the Distance Education Faculty (AÖF) exams could not enter the exam on January 16 and 17.
Milli E\u011fitim Bakanl\u0131\u011f\u01: The Ministry of National Education announced that the exams of the students in Silopi and Cizre will be done in Mardin.
Ancak il\u00e7elerde hala soka\u011fa \u: However, since the curfew continues in the districts, there are no cars going to Mardin and entrance to the districts is forbidden; the students that did not want to go could not take the exam.
\u00c7ok say\u0131da \u00f6l\u00fc ve ya: There are many dead and wounded
Bat\u0131 Afrika \u00fclkesi Burkina Fas: In Ouagadougou, the capital of the West African Country Burkina Faso, at least 23 people were killed and 33 people injured in gun and bomb attacks organized in a hotel that is popular among foreigners, and in the cafeteria next to it.
Silahl\u0131 sald\u0131r\u0131 sonras\u0: 126 people taken hostage were rescued during the operation which was carried out after the gun attack.
G\u00fcvenlik Bakan\u0131, sald\u0131rga: The Ministry of Security stated that three of the attackers were neutralised.
Silahl\u0131 ve mantolu bir\u00e7ok sald: Many attackers with guns and overcoats organized a raid on the 147-room hotel and luxury restaurant in the capital Ouagadougou at around 20:00 local time on Friday.
\u0130lk sald\u0131r\u0131dan 5 saat son: Having deployed 5 hours after the attack in Gao state, Mali, French and UN security forces started the operation and the first news regarding the rescue of the first hostage came.
Devlet Ba\u015fkan\u0131 Roch Marc Chris: President Roch Marc Christian Kabore stated that at least 23 people died and 33 people from 18 different nations were injured.
Sald\u0131r\u0131 sonras\u0131 yap\u0131: 126 people taken hostage were rescued with the operation which was carried out after the attack.
